title: Accounts Payable Clerk
description:
**InfuCare Rx** is a leading home infusion provider accredited by URAC and ACHC offering a specialized approach to caring for patients in need of IV therapy and specialty pharmacy services in the homecare setting. We have created an ethical, team oriented, and quality work environment for our employees that cultivates achievement and success.


**Job Summary:**
The Accounts Payable Clerk will manage accounts payable, assist with performing monthly P&L and balance sheet generation, assist with processing monthly accruals, allocations, revenue reconciliations and perform other projects, as necessary. This individual should have a strong knowledge of the general ledger and its relationship with the various sub-ledgers, as well as a strong understanding of monthly accruals related to payroll and other expenses. This is a long-term position with potential for growth as the finance and accounting department grows along with this dynamic company. **Primary Responsibilities:*** Complete payments and control expenses by receiving, processing, verifying, and reconciling invoices.
* Charge expenses to accounts and cost centers by analyzing invoice/expense reports and recording entries.
* Flag and clarify any unusual or questionable invoice items or prices.
* Monitor accounts to ensure payments are up to date.
* Research and resolve invoice discrepancies and issues.
* Maintain vendor files.
* Provide supporting documentation for audits.
* Maintain accurate historical records and confidentiality of organizational information.
* Assist with processing of expense reports.
* Analyze chargeback items, including travel and other miscellaneous expenses, including reviewing and correcting variances.
* Review and check postings from various modules, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, fixed assets, and expense management to determine accuracy.
* Assist in 1099 Filings and any other A/P related filings.
* AP to Inventory Reconciliation.
* Assist with special projects and other duties, as assigned.

 **Required Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s Degree (CPA is a plus) in accounting, finance or related field of study and work experience in the accounting field.
* 2-4 years of relevant work experience in the health care industry.
* Accounting: 2-4 years of experience.
* Experience working with a multi-site and multi-state organization.
* Must be detail-oriented, able to prioritize and multi-task.
* Must be proficient in Excel, Microsoft Dynamics Business Central a plus.
* Ability to handle and maintain confidentiality of information.
* Demonstration of the ability to work in a team-oriented environment.
* Must be capable of functioning with flexibility in assignments.
* Must possess strong written and verbal communications.

  

Physical Demands:
Required to stand, walk, sit, talk and hear; required to use hands to operate vehicles and office equipment; must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs; specific vision requirements for this job include: close, distance and peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position without compromising patient care.  

InfuCare Rx is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military status, marital status, citizenship/immigration status, sex (including pregnancy and relation conditions, sexual orientation, or gender identity), age (40 and older), disability, genetic information (including employer requests for, or purchase use, or disclosure of genetic tests, genetic services, or family medical history), retaliation for filing a charge, reasonably opposing discrimination, or participating in a discrimination lawsuit, investigation, or proceeding. Background checks and drug screens are part of our hiring process. Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) (PT Weekends) $23
description:
We are a private day and boarding school located in northern Westchester County, New York, serving the needs of an international coed population of children, adolescents and young adults on the autism spectrum. Connect to a career, where passion & purpose combine...

If you’re passionate about working with and mentoring students on the Autism Spectrum --- Come join our team!

**What are we looking for?**

The Direct Support Professional (DSP) is a year-round, non-live-in position. In collaboration with the Director of respective departments, the DPS provides front line direct care and administrative support for daily operations. The DSP is responsible for guiding and mentoring students, assisting with emergency response procedures, and collaborating with all members of the Shrub Oak staff. As an educator and mentor, the DSP works closely with colleagues to create/maintain an inclusive community and foster specific skill development to meet the individualized needs of Shrub Oak’s student population. Having access to confidential information regarding Shrub Oak and its students, discretion and independent judgement is required. The DSP also actively assists with other programs, events, and services administered through Campus Life or Education, and have the opportunity to be involved in a wide range of responsibilities.

**Required Skills – Competencies – Qualifications** 

* Manage the day-to-day direct care needs, operations and programs.
* Serve as a liaison between department and other key offices pertinent to the day-to-day operations.
* Develop and maintain trusting, respectful relationships with students, including understanding his/her unique interests, needs and goals, as well as the student body generally, to maintain a positive and cooperative environment
* Explain, enforce and support all policies and procedures to students ensuring an inclusive and respectful community, all to promote self-advocacy, collaboration, and independence
* Complete administrative tasks, including but not limited to, assisting with shift logs, maintenance requests, incident reports, behavior intervention plans and progress tracking
* Proactively work with students in crisis to de-escalate situations using SOIS protocol
* Attend to and report all emergencies and/or other situations requiring immediate attention in a timely manner to the appropriate staff member(s) in accordance with Shrub Oak policies/procedures
* Facilitate on-campus and off-campus programming and community development based on the needs of each student outlined by the student’s ITEP, faculty, clinicians or Campus Life model
* Advise, support and mentor students on various life skills and issues collaborating with faculty and clinicians as necessary and follow up with all issues regularly
* Support the individualized ITEP and other developmental goals for each student, collaborating with the ITEP team including documenting efforts and progress
* Serve as a campus and community resource for students and staff by advising and providing guidance in planning programs, activities, academic support
* Develop, present, track, and evaluate educational programs for students
* Collaborate with departmental staff to ensure all students maintain a regular and appropriate schedule of events and daily living activities
* Attend all required meetings and seminars as scheduled, including all staff orientation/training
* Support other department responsibilities as needed and determined

**Education and Experience** 

* 1 year minimum of relevant professional experience required; previous experience working in a school and particularly a boarding program a plus.
* Relevant combination of post-secondary education and/or experience working with special needs populations as a DPS, Social Worker, Recreational Therapist, Registered Behavioral Technician, Behavioral Specialist or a related position.
* Experience working with adolescents and young adults on the autism spectrum.
* Experience working with individuals exhibiting challenging behaviors.
* Experience working cross-functionally in a transdisciplinary program to consistently support our students.
* Ability to speak multiple languages is a plus

**Location:**Mohegan Lake, NY 10547

**Pay:** $23/hour

**Perks:** Benefits package including health\\*, vision, dental, and life insurance, tuition assistance, Paid Time Off (PTO), and more!

**Physical Demands**   
Physical demands may include but are not limited to sitting and require walking or standing to a significant degree. Lifting/carrying boxes up to 25 pounds, and the ability to rearrange furniture for events is occasionally required.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**   
Weekday mornings/afternoon/evenings/overnights and weekends shifts. Full-time and part-time positions may be available. Full-time staff work a traditional 40-hour work week. Your manager will discuss the shift hours, which could be day, evening and/or weekends.

**EEO Statement**   
Shrub Oak International School is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to apply for a job or to perform the essentials functions of his/her job. Please advise us if you require reasonable accommodation.

Shrub Oak International School maintains a smoke-free environment to ensure the health and safety of our students, employees and community. Smoking or vaping of any kind is strictly prohibited indoors, outdoors, and during off-campus activities, with enforcement measures in place including smoke/vape detectors. Non-compliance will result in disciplinary action disciplinary action including termination.

title: Azure Data Architect
description:
**Job Description** **Role: Azure Data Architect**

**Location: Allendale, NJ (Hybrid) 3 Days Onsite**

**Duration: 6+ Months**

**Must have experience in Azure Databricks** **and ADF, Azure Synapse, PySpark, SQL**


Experience: 12 to 15 Years , Minimum 5+ Years of experience in Azure Data Architect

* Overall 15+ years in data analytics consulting and at least 10+ Senior Architect role within a consulting firm with a focus on data analytics, advanced analytics, Cloud
* 5-7+ years in designing, solutioning the Azure Databricks, PySpark, Data engineering, Data Integration, Data Orchestration and Data Marketplace.
* 7+ years' experience in designing Azure data warehouse and Responsible for designing and implementing secure, scalable, and highly available cloud-based solutions and estimation on Azure Cloud.
* Cloud Architect with experience in Azure ADF, ADLS Gen2, Databricks, Synapse, PySpark
* Responsible for designing and implementing secure, scalable, and highly available cloud-based solutions and estimation on AWS and Azure Cloud
* Mandatory Experience in Azure Databricks and ADF, Azure Synapse and PySpark
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
* Hands on individual with ability to self-explore on market trends and provide POV on how it will have an impact on existing landscapes and suggest recommendations.
* Experience in within a consulting firm or similar environment, with a focus on cloud data analytics in the medical device industry other regulated industry preferred.
* Proficiency in data analytics tools and technologies, such as Python, R, SQL, and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).
* Deep technical understanding of major cloud tools like Azure, GCP, AWS, data analytics technologies, methodologies, and best practices.
* Strong technical experience in major BI reporting tools like Power BI
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Proven track record of successfully leading and delivering data analytics projects from conception to completion for fortune clients
* Relevant certifications in Azure, Databricks and Big Data are a plus.
* Experience with integration of different data sources with Data Warehouse and Data Lake is required
* Experience in creating Data warehouse, data lakes for Reporting, AI and Machine Learning
* Understanding of data modelling and data architecture concepts
* To be able to clearly articulate pros and cons of various technologies and platforms
* Collaborate with clients to understand their business requirements and translate them into technical solutions that leverage AWS and Azure cloud platforms.
* Define and implement cloud governance and best practices.
* Identify and implement automation opportunities to increase operational efficiency.
* Data Fabric, Mesh, Lakehouse data implementation experience
* Conduct knowledge sharing and training sessions to educate clients and internal teams on cloud technologies.

 **Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Billing Coordinator
description:
**Job Title: Billing Coordinator**

**Department:** Leasing & Contracts

**The TGI Story**


A second-generation family-owned business for over 50 years, TGI Office Automation is a comprehensive office technology provider offering scalable solutions for many of todays complex business issues. TGI offers unparalleled, innovative technology from a variety of industry-leading partners.


TGIs Mission Statement: Office automation empowers your business. By improving bottom-line profitability through smart, strategic solutions, we help our customers reduce costs and maintain a competitive position.


http://w3.tgioa.com/

**Summary:**TGI Office Automation seeks a bright, highly motivated, and enthusiastic Billing Coordinator to join the corporate leasing team in our Brooklyn headquarters. This is a great opportunity to join a fast-paced team that is focused on supporting the growth of our company.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Assist with and process all credit applications with various leasing companies gather all necessary information needed for the processing and closing of applications in a timely manner.
* Accurately and efficiently prepare and assist with all leasing paperwork. Verify the accuracy of all application information and documentation prior to deals being booked.
* Communicate with prospective customers, sales reps, and any other involved parties to obtain the necessary documentation for verification of application information.
* Provide exceptional customer service to sales reps and prospective customers while processing their applications.
* Provide application status updates to customers, resolve discrepancies or other issues.
* Proactively follow up on all applications and monitor turnaround time goals.
* Assist the department with any issues that arise.
* Closely work with sales reps daily.
* Perform other duties as required.

**Qualifications:**

* Education: College degree or higher
* Experience: Customer service, cross-referencing documents, industry experience and/or leasing experience is preferred
* Personality: friendly and engaging, team player

**Skills:**

* Proficient with MS Office programs (Excel, Word, and Outlook)
* Professional presentation; is confident, enthusiastic and displays a high level of self-motivation.
* Good time management skills to ensure assigned responsibilities are completed in an efficient manner; able to work independently.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal; can communicate effectively with sales reps, customers, and others, in person, over the phone and email, and with all levels of management.

**Job Type:** Full-time

**Pay:** 22$-25$ an hour

**Benefits:** Dental insurance, Health insurance, Vision Insurance, PTO, and 401(k)

title: Dentist - Daytime
description:
*Your privacy is important to us. All applications are strictly confidential.*

**Refuah Health**is a federally qualified health center offering comprehensive care in Rockland and Sullivan Counties. We are over one hundred healthcare professionals strong with three decades experience providing unparalleled patient care. As an FQHC, we specialize in accessible and affordable care for low income and high-risk residents. We believe in the power of people to create great care and we are inviting the best healthcare professionals to build their career with us!


The general Dentist is responsible for providing comprehensive dental care to health center patients, including definitive, emergency, restorative and preventive dental care.

**This position includes daytime plus Sunday hours.**

**Why Refuah?**

* Join a collegial team of dental care professionals
* Five modern state of the art facilities
* Flexible schedules for maximum work-life balance
* Financial stability with no billing or overhead responsibility
* New graduates and experienced candidates encouraged to apply

**Dentist Responsibilities:**

* Performs routine examinations and treatment.
* Diagnoses ailments of oral cavity. Performs and interprets X-rays.
* Performs teeth cleaning and dental work, including crowns, bridges, dentures, etc.
* Performs limited dental surgery, restricted to extractions.
* Documents patients dental history and treatment.
* Supervises dental assistants and hygienists.
* Performs patient pain management techniques.
* Complies with applicable policies and procedures and supports the ComplianceProgram.
* Contributes to organizational operations by performing other duties as may berequired.

**Refuah Benefits:**

* **Competitive Compensation**:Our salaries are in line with fair market value, reflecting your skills and dedication.
* **Our facilities are eligible for NHSC loan repayment and NYS Public Loan Forgiveness to help manage your financial burden.**
* **Comprehensive Benefits:**We provide full benefits, including life, health, dental, and vision coverage, ensuring your well-being.
* **Paid Malpractice Insurance:** FTCA Malpractice Coverage.
* **Financial Planning:**Benefit from our 403B plan, ensuring your financial security for the future.
* **Tax Advantages:** Flexible Spending Accounts and Health Reimbursement Cards.
* **Professional Growth:**Support for CME activities and medical licensure ensures you stay at the forefront of your field.
* **Work-Life Balance:** Enjoy generous PTO accruals and up to 13 Paid Holidays.

**Live, Work and Play in Rockland:**

* Situated along the majestic Hudson River
* Easy drive to New York City and airports
* Scenic waterfront villages
* Mountain vistas and parks; hiking and biking trails
* Prestigious schools and universities
* Vibrant health, retail, manufacturing, pharmaceutical and construction industries

**What You Bring To Refuah:**

* DDS/DMD from a dental education program accredited by the Commission on Dental Accreditation
* Current, valid NYS license to practice dentistry
* Active NY DEA Registration
* Other certifications as required by state to include- CPR/ DEA
* Eligible to Work in the US

**Apply Today:**


If you are a dedicated Dentist looking to make a positive impact, we invite you to apply. Join Refuah in transforming the healthcare experience. Apply now to be a part of our dynamic medical team.

**Principals only. Recruiters, please do not contact us regarding this job.**

title: Calibration Technician
description:
**Calibration Technician**

**Instrumentation Technical Services LLC**, a part of the Applied Technical Services Family of Companies, is an ISO 9001 registered and ISO 17025:2017 accredited calibration service provider and metrology laboratory. Our company is based in West Chester, PA and performs high level calibrations for clients throughout the US. We provide industry leading process controls, laboratory, and metrology services to a wide range of industry partners. We are looking to expand and add new members to our growing team. We offer classroom and hands-on training opportunities, and the ability to work in a variety of industries. We value military service and prioritize the hiring of veterans and provide flexibility for those with reserve responsibilities.


We offer a competitive compensation packages that include health benefits and matched 401K plans.


Our current open positions are full time.

***Position Prerequisites***


Interested technicians should understand calibration principles and be familiar with laboratory, process, and/or analytical instrumentation. Candidates should be self-motivated and capable of working autonomously, or as part of a team, using in-house procedures and standards and/or as outlined by customer requirements. Technicians should also have strong customer service skills placing emphasis on exceeding customer expectations. Your ability to learn and enhance your skillset will be met with opportunities and challenges to ensure your successful personal and professional growth within our organization.

***Required:***

* An Associates degree in Electronics, Instrumentation, physics or other associated discipline, or equivalent military training.
* 3+ years experience working in metrology or process controls and calibration.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Basic knowledge of computers and software; competency in using Microsoft Office products strongly desired.
* Ability to kneel, climb, and stand for long periods.
* Ability to lift and/or carry 50+ pounds.
* Must have and maintain clean driving record, background check and drug screen
* Must be available to travel up to 50%
* Detail and quality oriented
* Candidate shall provide their own cell phone with data plan for connection to ATS email and multi-factor authentication

***Preferred:***

* Experience working in a cGMP regulated industries following good documentation practices.
* Experience working in an ISO 17025 environment utilizing processes that identify and quantify contributors of uncertainty.
* Multidisciplinary knowledge of mechanical, electronic, and/or laboratory equipment common to pharmaceutical/medical device manufacturing environments.
* Strong math skills including algebra, geometry, and statistics.
* Well-developed troubleshooting techniques.
* ASQ/CCT or CMT certification


Pay range is $25-$35 / hour

title: Store Manager
description:
**Job Summary:**  

We are seeking a Retail Store Manager to join our team!
  
Our Store Managers recruit and develop staff, manage in-store product assortments and inventory, analyze margin and profit levels, drive store top line sales and comp sales increases, advocate superior customer service, and develop strategies to address opportunities.

Demonstrate a thorough working knowledge of all aspects of store operations. Meet or exceed assigned goals and objectives through labor management, comp sales increases, customer service metrics, auto service metrics, fiscal accountability, and merchandising.
  
Commit to providing exceptional customer service on a daily basis.
  
Lead recruiting initiatives building a strong staff by interviewing, selecting and hiring individuals that will be a part of a single high functioning team.
  
Consistently evaluate and develop talent.
  
Effectively coach those employees performing below expectations through effective communication, timely feedback, and performance appraisals.
  
Drive sales at high velocity by using superior merchandising skills to ensure the best visual placement of product.
  
Use project management skills to organize, plan and set deadlines for initiatives, as well as monitor progress to ensure goals are met.
  
Demonstrate the ability to multi-task and respond quickly and appropriately to changing environments. Creating solutions for any sales and operations challenges faced by the retail store.
  
Ensure compliance of all policies, procedures, and practices at all times, both personally and by all Team Members.
  
Planning and meeting the Weekly and Monthly Sales Goals.
  
Create and maintain a pleasurable working environment for the staff.

High school diploma or GED required.
  
Associates or Bachelors degree in Retail Management, Business, or related field strongly desired.
  
Retail Store Management experience required.
  
Strong cognitive skills including problem analysis, decision making, and financial analysis.
  
General knowledge of and ability to operate a personal computer, including proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.
  
Ability to motivate and inspire a team to ensure high level performance.
  
Will work a rotating schedule including days, nights, weekends and holidays.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Sales Development Representative


Location: Remote


Learning Ally is a leading nonprofit education solutions organization that transforms the lives of struggling learners by delivering proven literacy solutions that help students reach their potential. Its mission is to radically change education, transforming the lives of children by providing reading interventions and solutions to help them succeed academically, build self-confidence, and thrive in school and beyond.


65% of fourth graders read below proficiency and are 400% more likely to drop-out of high school. And, for “most at risk” students (students of color, low income, English Language Learners and students with learning disabilities) the problem is even more acute.


Learning Ally seeks to break this cycle. With early student assessment, intervention and accommodation and professional development for educators, Learning Ally can identify and prevent learning issues by working with schools and educators to support new and struggling readers. Our solutions build a strong foundation for independent, engaged learners who are empowered to achieve socially, emotionally, and academically, regardless of background or learning difference.


Founded in 1948 as Recording for the Blind, to help soldiers who lost their sight in combat continue their education with audiobook products, Learning Ally has evolved to help individuals understand the unique ways they learn and match them to the solutions that enable personal achievement.


Today, Learning Ally reaches over 2,300,000 students, 615,000 educators and 23,000 schools across the country and continues to expand its reach. With a continued commitment to supporting students who learn differently, Learning Ally has joined researchers and neuroscientists from renowned institutions including UCSF and MIT, to better understand and address learning issues. You will find that our culture is one that is very committed to our mission, innovation, professional growth, and diversity, equity, and inclusion.

**Purpose of the Position:** Working in a team environment and in conjunction with the Sales Managers as well as the Implementation Success Managers, the SDR is responsible for researching and identifying potential clients and providing leads (appointments) to the Sales team to achieve sales and revenue quotas for the assigned territory, providing leads (appointments) to the Sales team to achieve sales and revenue quotas, and to build our brand awareness with prospective clients in the assigned territories.

**Responsibilities**:


This role is responsible for identifying and creating new qualified sales opportunities in Target Accounts through both inbound and outbound activities. The SDR will become a trusted resource and develop relationships with prospects acting as the initial point of contact. This role will be primarily focused around researching companies through emails, calls, social media and securing meetings for our Sales team.

* Independently schedule and conduct an average of 70+outbound calls per day to ensure quota attainment
* Create a sales pipeline, with prospects and new opportunities for the sales team
* Educate prospective clients on the benefits of Learning Ally’s literacy products as necessary ( i.e., Audiobook solution, PL, and Excite Reading)
* Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of Audio Book solutions, Excite Reading, and Professional Learning products
* Respond, engage, and qualify inbound leads and inquiries
* Engage current users to expand awareness and to ask for referrals
* Collaborate with the sales team on strategic sales approach and help as needed to build awareness on special projects / events
* Ensure cold calls and activity quotas are met
* Document weekly scheduling in NetSuite and clearly outline and communicate follow up activity
* Ensure that all interactions with internal and external customers adhere to the standards and integrity of the organization
* Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to profile strategic accounts, identify key individuals, research and obtain business requirements and present solutions to start the sales cycle
* Go the extra mile to engage customers - Use consultative sales skills to communicate the value and benefits of Learning Ally products that best match the needs of our customers
* Develop new opportunities with existing customers by following up on all incoming calls and leads to ensure every customer opportunity is given professional and proper attention
* Develop and maintain a strong knowledge of market competitors in order to use this knowledge to overcome objections and to advise prospects on the benefits of Learning Ally products and services

**Job Requirements**

**Education:**

title: Counselor MH
description:
**SUMMARY**


The Mental Health Counselor will counsel individuals and groups to promote optimum mental health. The Mental Health Counselor will help individuals deal with thoughts of suicide; addictions and substance abuse; family, parenting, and marital problems; stress management; problems with self-esteem; and issues associated with aging and mental and emotional health.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES****include the following.**Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned.

* Counsels clients and patients, individually and in group sessions, to assist in overcoming dependencies, adjusting to life, and making changes. Maintains confidentiality of records relating to clients treatment.
* Guides clients in the development of skills and strategies to deal with their problems. Encourages clients to express their feelings and discuss what is happening in their lives and helps them develop insight into themselves and their relationships.
* Collects information about clients through interviews, observations, and tests. Prepares and maintains treatment records and reports.
* Evaluates the clients physical or mental condition based on the review of client information. Develops and implements treatment plans based on clinical experience and knowledge. Acts as a client advocate to coordinate required services or to resolve emergency problems in crisis situations.
* Other duties as assigned

**COMPETENCIES (KSAs)**

* Ethical Practices
* Judgment
* Relationship Management
* Emotional Intelligence
* Empathy
* Professional Boundaries
* Global and Cultural Awareness
* Critical Evaluation
* Problem Solving
* Decision Making
* Communication
* Teamwork
* Crisis Management
* Technical Capacity

**REQUIRED EDUCATION**

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Preferred, bachelors degree in psychology, counseling, or a related field is required.
* Appropriate state credentials and licensing are required.

**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE**

* Two years of experience working in the mental health field
* Knowledge of human behavior and performance; individual differences in ability, personality, and interests; learning and motivation; psychological research methods; and the assessment and treatment of behavioral and affective disorders.
* Knowledge of principles, methods, and procedures for diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of physical and mental dysfunctions, and for career counseling and guidance.
* Knowledge of group behavior and dynamics, societal trends and influences, human migrations, ethnicity, and cultures and their history and origins.
* Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services.
* An ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with mentally or emotionally disabled persons and their families is a must.

### **WORK ENVIRONMENT**

* This job operates in an indoor office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, and photocopiers.

### **PHYSICAL DEMANDS**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential duties and responsibilities.

* Regularly required to sit, use hands to type, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear.
* Frequently required to stand, walk, stoop, kneel or crouch and lift and/or move up to 30 pounds

title: Director of Weekend Operations
description:
**About us**

Rise Talent Solutions LLC is a boutique consulting firm that works with organizations across the country in various industries to access, meet, and exceed their talent acquisition needs, from strategy to execution.

A renowned multi-site youth organization is seeking a dynamic and experienced Director of Weekend Operations to oversee all special events and weekend classes across multiple locations in New York City. This role is crucial in ensuring the smooth planning, coordination, and execution of high-quality events and programs, delivering exceptional experiences for our families. The typical schedule for this position is Wednesday-Sunday or Thursday-Monday.

**What you’ll do:**

* Manage the entire event planning process, from initial booking with families to final execution.
* Develop and implement a standardized system for booking and coordinating events across all locations.
* Ensure all event logistics are handled efficiently, including setup, staffing, and teardown.
* Supervise Special Events/Weekend Managers and their teams to ensure high-quality service delivery.
* Provide training, development, and ongoing support to team members to enhance their skills and performance.
* Conduct regular performance reviews and provide constructive feedback.
* Design and implement workflows and processes to improve efficiency and coordination across locations.
* Monitor and evaluate operational processes, making adjustments as needed to optimize performance.
* Collaborate with the operations team to ensure seamless event execution.
* Maintain high standards for all events, ensuring they meet excellent quality and safety guidelines.
* Address and resolve any issues or concerns that arise during events promptly and professionally.
* Gather and analyze feedback from families and team members to continuously improve the event experience.
* Serve as the central point of contact for all special events and weekend activities.
* Foster strong relationships with families, ensuring clear communication and understanding of their needs and expectations.
* Work closely with the marketing and communication team to promote events and ensure consistency in messaging.

**What you bring:**

* Minimum of 3 years of experience in event planning and operations management, preferably in an early childhood or family-oriented environment.
* Proven track record of successfully managing multiple events and teams across various locations.
* Strong leadership and team development skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire staff.
* Excellent organizational and project management abilities.
* Ability to work weekends and adapt to a flexible schedule as needed.
* Results oriented with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and fun childhood environment.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with customers and team members.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
* Must be honest, dependable, receptive to feedback, and able to meet deadlines.
* Self-motivated and able to work independantly.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year

* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

title: IVF Coordinator
description:
**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

*(In compliance with the American with Disabilities Act, ADA, this description identifies the essential components of the job required to be performed with or without reasonable accommodations. Requests for reasonable accommodations to facilitate the performance of these essential functions will be given careful consideration.)*

**Essential Functions:**

* Coordinate and schedule all IVF/FET cycles:
	+ Schedule patients for all appointments necessary for the completion of the IVF checklist (labs, saline sonogram, cultures, uterine sounding, SA, etc.).
	+ Responsible for who is starting and when, and if not starting, documenting why. Provide written protocol specific schedule for patient up to time of gonadotropin start.
	+ Register Patients for appropriate Online IVF class Engaged MD.
	+ Provide patients with all necessary educational materials; Including Patient Handbook, IVF checklist, reminders, and complementary services (genetic counselor, nutritionist, social worker).
	+ Ensure patient cycle medication pre-certification is initiated with Pre-cert coordinator. Confirm pre-certification is completed prior to calling in medications.
	+ Maintain channel of communication with finance department regarding patients financial clearance for IVF cycle prior to GND start. Alert finance coordinator of any changes in protocol or cycle status
	+ Schedule and review IVF checklist with patient to determine if completed
		- Advise RN when chart is ready for final review and sign off
		- Adhere to lab review SOP
		- Enter proper lab orders into resource when scheduling patient for checklist screening
		- Make sure all labs are current if patient cycling again
		- If checklist not completed: track down labs, determine if they were drawn, etc.
	+ Distribute all necessary consents (IVF, ICSI, Embryo cryo, donor sperm, PGT, FET, etc.) and adhere to all policies for proper consent witnessing and processing. Counsel patients that consents should be completed prior to GND start.
	+ Arrange weekly IVF meeting with physician team for case review
		- Prepare a list of patients to be discussed, both upcoming and in cycle, any problem or unusual case
		- Enter data in resource chart:
			* Protocol information
			* Medication dosage established and documented
			* TESE and other urology parameters reviewed by TESE Team
			* Additional Details noted- med clearance, anesthesia clearance, MFM, outside referrals, etc.king environment
* Responsible for RESource entries of any special cycle requirements and diagnosis as determined by physician at case review.
* Coordinate with urology team and embryology managers regarding any IVF cycles requiring TESE


	+ Transfer all relevant data regarding male patient onto resource stimulation chart including order of plan for cases, anesthesia use, etc.
* Meet regularly and work collaboratively with nursing staff to:


	+ Review upcoming IVF cycle
	+ Check charts for completion
	+ Make certain medications have been called in or prescriptions have been given to patient
	+ Confirm written protocol instructions for cycle have been prepared and sent to patient
* Assist patients with understanding of ordering process when using donor sperm for their IVF cycles :


	+ Ensure patient has been given appropriate donor sperm ordering information and consents, and that patient receives instructions to return them prior to the delivery of donor sperm.
* Provide emotional support to patients when speaking with them.
* Create and maintain IVF database (IVF Scheduler). Review of starts should be done on a weekly basis to ensure accuracy and proper patient follow up.
* Collaborate with team to collect pregnancy and cycle outcomes for SART Coordinator in the maintenance of SART data and statistics.
* Coordinate all aspects of PGT cycles:
	+ Schedule patient/partner for pre-screening.
	+ Establish and maintain contacts with relevant labs
	+ Schedule cycle according to embryology lab guidelines
	+ Provide patient with appropriate consents
	+ Provide appropriate paperwork to PGT lab
	+ Refer patients to genetic counselor as needed
* Coordinate all Egg Freezing cycles, including oncofertility cases.
	+ Schedule patients for checklist requirements
	+ Schedule cycle according to embryology lab guidelines
	+ Provide patients with appropriate consents
	+ Register patients for appropriate online class
	+ Work collaboratively with Extend Fertility, when necessary
* Participate in the orientation of new IVF coordinators; Attend team meetings for updates
* Work collaboratively with lab team to facilitate the transfer in of gametes to our embryology lab

**CONFIDENTIAL AND SENSITIVE INFORMATION:**

* Maintain patient confidence and protect operations by keeping all patient information confidential.

**SCOPE OF FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY:**

* Cooperate with all practice billing and reimbursement policies, especially by confirming that the correct referral/authorization for treatment and insurance verification sticker are in patients chart.
* Direct patients starting treatment to patient accounts department.
* Participate in cost containment by appropriate use of medical & office supplies, and other budget requirements as communicated by practice management.

**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/PERFORMANCE FACTOR REQUIREMENTS:**

* 4 year Bachelors Degree preferred
* Ability to access, input, and retrieve information from a computer.
* High level of listening skills. Ability to communicate accurately and concisely.
* Aptitude to work independently and demonstrate good judgment
* Knowledge of office procedure and office machines (i.e. computer, fax, copier, etc.).

**PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:**

**Interpersonal Skills**

* Is enthusiastic and maintains a positive attitude.
* Develops positive working relationships with colleagues, promoting team spirit.
* Uses tact and skill in confronting difficult interpersonal situations; avoids unnecessary conflict.
* Works well with diverse personalities.
* Wins cooperation from others.

**Work Ethic**

* Exhibits honesty and integrity and develops trust.
* Volunteers for work when unassigned and makes productive use of unassigned time.
* Is a self-starter.
* Demonstrates a professional attitude and commitment and is an example to colleagues.
* Uses knowledge, experience, common sense and the highest ethical standards in dealing with sensitive situations.
* Follows through on commitments.
* Accepts share of less desirable assignments.

**Leadership**

* Demonstrates maturity, poise, and self-confidence in dealing with patients, physicians, management and staff.
* Is an effective role model.
* Takes responsibility for work product and demonstrates reliability.
* Communicates in a clear, confident, and effective manner.
* Deals effectively with stress and frustration.
* Earns respect of patients, physicians, management, and colleagues.
* Champions the mission and shared values through demonstrated action.
* Develops and is open to innovative ideas, approaches and viewpoints.
* Recognizes change as an opportunity to grow.
* Manages conflicting personal and professional requirements.
* Seeks opportunity to mentor colleagues as appropriate.

**Writing Skills**

* Communication is concise, well-organized, includes significant issues.

**Speaking Skills**

* Exhibits confidence and willingness to effectively communicate with patients, physicians, management and colleagues. Has refined verbal communication skills.

**Presence**

* Demonstrates maturity, poise, and self-confidence.
* Earns the professional respect of others.
* Dress, neatness of grooming, etc, projects an image of a competent professional.
* Shows pride in and actively promote its reputation, physicians and services.

**Initiative & Motivation**

* Acknowledges responsibility to ensure that assignments are satisfactorily completed.
* Demonstrates a personal commitment to her own professional development.
* Is a self-starter.
* Actively seeks out additional responsibilities; Persistent in overcoming obstacles.
* Responsive to formal and informal feedback.
* Is interested in opportunities within the Practice.
* Demonstrates energy, stamina, drive, and enthusiasm and is willing to work long hours when necessary.
* Understands her own strengths and weaknesses and, with the help of others, undertakes a program of self-development.

**Teamwork**

* Strong team player with a positive attitude toward the job and work being performed.
* Wins cooperation from others.
* Shows integrity, honesty, openness, and tact in dealing with others.
* Is proactive in developing relationships within the department and with other departments.
* Places team before individual goals and contribute to a positive working environment.

**ADDITIONAL JOB SPECIFICATIONS:**

**Physical Requirements:**

* Intermittent physical activity including walking, standing, sitting, lifting, and supporting patients. Grasping and feeling are necessary body movements.
* Sensory requirements of speech, touch, vision, and hearing to normal range, with or without correction.

**Mental Requirements:**

* Must have the ability to perform concentrated and complex mental activity.
* Must have the ability to work successfully under stressful conditions, and must be capable of adapting to varying workloads and work assignments on a frequent basis.
* Must have the ability to make sound, independent judgments, and also be able to collaborate with other multidisciplinary team members in an appropriate fashion.
* Must have the ability to comprehend and perform oral and written instructions.
* Must have effective reading and comprehension skills.
* Must have strong communication skills, written and verbal to work with and/or care for people of all professional and social levels.

**Environmental Conditions:**

* Will work in an inside environment with temperature control.
* Some electrical hazards working with equipment. Some examples of equipment used are computer terminal, calculator, copy machine, fax machine, telephone, and patient care items requiring electricity.
* Some overtime maybe required.
* Work routines/schedules are occasionally subject to change on short notice.

***All RMA LIIVF employees must perform their respective functions to ensure the patient has the most positive experience at every point of contact with our practice.***

***This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive statement of every duty and responsibility required by the jobholder. RMA LIIVF hopes each jobholder can react to reasonable change productively and handle other tasks assigned.***

***RMA LIIVF is a multi-site practice. There may be times you are requested to participate in assignments at other locations. Without causing undue hardship or significant personal inconvenience, RMA LIIVF proposes a solid team approach to our availability regarding the need and development of all our office locations.***

***This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an at will relationship.***

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
**Job Summary**


What is a Direct Support Professional?


The Direct Support Professional (DSP) is responsible for implementing person-centered services for each individual. This includes ensuring implementation of the individuals services, goals, and outcomes in relation to program-based and community inclusion activities. In addition, the Direct Support Professional is solely responsible for the individual's overall physical and emotional well-being.

**Job Responsibilities**


You would be responsible for:

* Under supervision, provide support and services which involve advocating for, encouraging, guiding, and teaching individuals in expressing personal choice, ensuring community integration, assisting individuals with personal hygiene care, toileting, lifts and transfers, dining, dressing, and meal preparation.
* You would help individuals to participate in games and recreational programs; coach and encourage individuals to develop daily living skills; and provide a clean, safe, and comfortable environment.
* You would collaborate with other staff to implement and record care plans and, in accordance with special instructions, you may administer medication. *These positions are physically demanding*.
* You would need to be prepared to act to ensure the health and safety of individuals in emergency situations.
* You will participate in staff meetings, in-service training and on-site workshops as required for professional growth and development. Attending external training and workshops in the direction of direct supervisor or program management. Maintain certification in \\*AMAP, CPR, First Aid and SCIP, as required. ***\\*Note: Failure to maintain AMAP certification can result in removal of full-time employee status.***
* You must be able to stand for extended periods of time, bend, stretch, and lift bedridden and/or incapacitated individuals.
* You will help to promote and support the inclusion of individuals in their community according to their unique needs, interests, and desires. Model and encourage interaction between individuals and community members. Help foster individuals personal growth by assisting in forming and maintaining friendships with neighbors, co-workers, and peers.
* You will help with transporting individuals or assist them in taking public transportation.
* You will assist in maintaining positive communications with family members, advocates, and service providers as per program needs.


To learn more about what direct support professionals do on the job every day, go tohttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cnK4z3KAqtE

**Qualifications**


You are a good fit if you have:

* High school diploma, GED, CNA (Certified Nursing Assistant certification) or possess a Direct Support Professional (DSP) certificate from an accredited public or private organization.
* One year or more work experience with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred.
* Excellent written, communication and mathematical skills.
* Valid NYS driver license preferred but not required.
* A flexible work schedule.

**Benefits**


What we offer once YOU join our growing family:


At HeartShare we offer a comprehensive benefit package based on full-time/part-time status. You can expect:

* Paid time off (holidays, vacation in accordance with school calendar, sick and personal)
* Professional development opportunities
* Team environment
* Medical and dental benefits
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Optional insurance (life, disability, etc.)
* 403(B) retirement plans
* Flexible spending account (dependent care, medical, parking, and transit)
* Employee assistance program


HeartShare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). If you need to request accommodation during the recruiting process, please reach out to Leaves@heartshare.org.

**About HeartShare**


Who WE ARE:


For over one hundred years, HeartShare has dedicated itself to improving the lives of people needing special services and support. The HeartShare team, now 2,100 employees and growing, helps individuals develop to their fullest potential and lead meaningful and enriched lives.


To learn more about HeartShare, please visit our website at www.heartshare.org or Follow us onTwitterLinkedInYouTubeInstagramFacebook

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
The Administrative Coordinator is responsible for the coordination of office systems for the Department. This includes, but is not limited to payroll, regulatory documentation and mandates, and supervision of office staff.


Use discretion and independent judgment involving the comparison and evaluation of possible courses of conduct. Their judgments may affect business operations or have a significant financial impact.


Has the authority to waive or deviate from established rules or policies but will always keep open the lines of communication of such issues with their direct supervisor and/or upper administration, as this makes for best business practices.


Has reasonable input into decision of who to hire, transfer, suspend, lay off, recall, promote, discharge, reward or discipline, adjust employees grievances, assign duties and schedules, and responsibly direct employees they supervise.


Ensure a division of work duties with other office staff and oversees their quality of work.


Create the scheduling of duties and the upkeep of office calendars for office staff and consults with the SVP, COS & Director as needed.


Ensure time accrual is updated and maintained on an on-going basis.


Respond to payroll inquiries from staff as needed.


Oversee specialized projects to ensure the effective and efficient running of the Department.


Assist with the response format to Program audits.


Assist in the preparation of annual trend reports, applications and data collection.


Oversee document management with the Department using established guidelines.


Oversee and approve the submission of designated office system supply orders.


Work closely with Human Resources in critical employment areas such as new hires, leaves, workers compensation, changes of status and separations from the Agency.


Work closely with the SVP, COS, Director and/or Education Coordinators with day-to-day staff-related issues such as attendance, punctuality, receipt of requested paperwork, etc.


Coordinate and arranges meetings and ensures agenda is distributed and may be asked to participate in various meetings as required.


Conduct meetings with office staff to share information and monitor office needs and functioning.


Maintain special projects, charts, lists, or forms as required.


Maintain the personnel records of the Department ensuring Human Resources has the originals of all documents.


Schedule appointments and relay general business information to callers.


Read and comprehend instructions, correspondence, and memos. Compose routine reports, memos, responses to usual correspondence, etc.


Ensure the high quality of all office functions, including typing, filing, copying, faxing, telephone work, etc.


Follow verbal and written instructions.


Mandatory attendance at required in-service training, along with ability to absorb and demonstrate compliance with all regulations and Block Institute policy and procedure requirements is required for this position.


Collaborate with HR Onboarding specialist.


Keep track of all certificate renewals.


Utilize and manage all users in TEAMS.


Update and maintain student Medical Records


Prepare and maintain staff database. (medicals, DOH trainings, certifications etc.)


Prepare NEW hires with OSHA training


Responsible for Purchasing App orders


Attendance/Punctuality is consistently at work and on time. Ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent. Arrive at meetings and appointments on time.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**


Supervise the office staff of the Department and others as assigned by COS.


**Competency:** To perform the job successfully an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:


Excellent Organizational Skills Strong Interpersonal Skills


Team Member Good Oral and Written Comm. Skills


Payroll Experience Good Math Skills


Detail Oriented Quality/ Accuracy of Work


Problem Solving Ability to Meet Deadlines


Maintains Confidentiality Knowledge of Computer Programs


Knowledge of Facility office machinery (copiers, faxes, phones, scanners, etc.)

**Physical Demands:**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand, sit, use hands to finger, handle or feel, talk and hear. Specific vision abilities include close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust focus.

**Work Environment:**


The environment in the office setting offers no unusual situations, although some sites may have stairs and those must be navigated. The position requires the ability to work in a busy, occasionally noisy office, with many people and distractions daily. Travel between various sites by means of public or private transportation is required, with weather conditions unpredictable.

**Minimum Education:**Associate's degree or equivalent, **Preferred Education:** Bachelor's degree or equivalent with four years' experience in computer proficiency in word, excel and payroll experience.

**Benefits:**


At HeartShare we offer a comprehensive benefit package based on full-time/part-time status. You can expect:

* Paid time off (holidays, vacation in accordance with school calendar, sick and personal)
* Professional development opportunities
* Team environment
* Medical and dental benefits
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Optional insurance (life, disability, etc.)
* 403(B) retirement plans
* Flexible spending account (dependent care, medical, parking, and transit)
* Employee assistance program


HeartShare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). If you need to request accommodation during the recruiting process, please reach out to Leaves@heartshare.org.
company_description: Supporting and empowering people with disabilities, children in foster care, low-income families and other vulnerable New Yorkers.

title: Parent Advocate, Foster Care
description:
HeartShare is looking for a **Parent Advocate** for our Foster Care Program


Parent Advocates will use their former Child Welfare experience to support and advocate for parents to help reunite them with their child.

**Responsibilities:**

* Maintains a tracking system of referrals and case assignments.
* Provides assistance in facilitating training in topics including, but not limited to the Parenting Journey.
* Encourages parents participation in Family Team Conferences (FTCS) providing reminders and other supports as warranted.
* Represents HeartShare St. Vincent's Services at internal and external meetings.
* Celebrates birth parents by contributing to hosting events and activities.
* Maintains accessible resource materials, making them available to other HSVS staff and to parents.
* Documents efforts to engage parents via service plans.
* Provides full disclosure and all required consents to birth parents.
* Co-facilitates quarterly birth parent round table meetings.

**Housing**  

Provides direct counseling, on-call assistance, intervention, negotiation and advocacy regarding birth families housing needs.

* Develops and maintains a comprehensive list of available housing resources.
* Collects required documentation, completes online applications and records data in all applicable Housing systems including the New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA) and Supportive Housing systems.
* Delivers completed Housing application packets to the New York City Administration for Children's Services (ACS)
* Accompanies parents to Housing court and to government assistance offices.
* Maintains all reporting requirements set by funding and/or regulatory agencies.
* Assist and accompany parents when shopping to purchase furniture for new apartments once children are final discharged from care.
* Demonstrated responsible and professional telephone, email and interview etiquette
* Attended all required training to ensure up to date information
* Demonstrated passion for working with birth parents and at risk teens in a child welfare setting.
* Able to set limits and to maintain appropriate professional boundaries
* Strong belief in families abilities to grow and change.
* Self-motivated
* Strong time management, writing and organizational skills
* Works, both, independently and collaboratively with colleagues and stakeholders
* Willing and able to travel throughout the five boroughs of New York City as needed.


The Parent Advocate must have:

* **Must have lived experience with ACS**
* **Child Welfare Case must be closed for 1 year**
* High school diploma/General Equivalency Diploma (GED);
* Experience working with families;
* Knowledge of foster care and ACS mandates;
* Knowledge of CONNECTIONS preferred
* Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to travel within the 5 boroughs of NYC, Long Island, and Westchester
	+ Physical Requirement:
* The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit, and reach with hands and arms.

**Benefits:**

* Rewarding Work in a team environment;
* Paid vacation, sick, personal days and holidays;
* 403(B) retirement plan with employer contribution;
* Health, dental, vision and life insurance;
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
* Flexible spending account (Dependent Care, Medical, Parking, and Transit);
* Employee Appreciation Programs and Events;
* Tuition Assistance Program;
* Professional Development opportunities;
* Gympass Discount
* Verizon Wireless Discount;
* BJs Membership discount;
* Discounts on Broadway tickets, movie tickets, theme parks, sporting events, gift certificates & more.

description:

title: Wild Encounters Coordinator
description:
**Wild Encounters Coordinator, Visitor Services Department**

**Job Description** 

We have an immediate opening for a Wild Encounters Coordinator in the Visitor Services team at the Bronx Zoo. This position will play an exciting leadership role in making meaningful connections to guests through our cart tours, concierge experience offerings, and up-close animal experiences. The position’s core responsibilities include; conducting VIP programs, overseeing daily operations, and mentoring Wild Encounter Hosts.

**Essential duties include:**

* Maintaining a thorough understanding of Wild Encounters programs, policies, and guest experience to assist VIP guests with planning their Wild Encounter experience(s).
* Working collaboratively within and across department teams including, but not limited to, Animal Encounters, Global Resources, Public Affairs, and Group Sales.
* Support Manager in training and monitoring of Hosts to ensure accurate and engaging program delivery.
* Performing professional customer service and reliable administrative tasks with accurate order processing, and clear communication with guests and staff.
* Ensuring the up-sell of other unique experiences, programming, and/or annual Membership options, to help cultivate long-lasting relationships with clients and WCS.
* Safely operating a 4-15 passenger cart.
* Serving as senior staff person to provide day-of leadership and coordination as assigned and in absence of VIP Manager.

**Daily Senior Staff duties include:**

* Run morning meetings for Hosts.
* Check guest correspondence (voicemail and email) to respond and address in a timely manner.
* Communicate with animal department to confirm that day’s program schedule and any updates.
* Act as primary contact-person for other departments including Internal Reservations, for urgent response or relevant day-of updates.
* Generate and monitor daily roster and shift assignments for Hosts, make appropriate adjustments as needed.
* Provide a summary of the day to the Manager and Department Director.

Qualification Requirements :

* Stand and walk for long periods of time.
* Ability to lift and/or move 20-50 pounds.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office programs.
* Comfortable being exposed to cold and hot weather.
* Ability to work a flexible work schedule, including holidays and weekends.
* Valid driver’s license and good driving record required.
* Ability to monitor and act in the best interest of guest safety and animal welfare at all times.
* Adapt easily to changing circumstances in a busy work environment.
* High School Diploma or equivalent required.
* Experience in presentations, public speaking, and/or customer service.
* Prior experience in a leadership role in a customer-facing environment.
* Academic studies in a related field (biology, education, ecology, etc.) preferred.

Job Types: Part-time, Seasonal

Pay: $26.00 per hour

Expected hours: 25 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Holidays
* Monday to Friday
* On call
* Overtime
* Weekends as needed

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Bronx, NY 10460: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Recovery Peer
description:
Responsibilities:


Outreach and engage individuals at risk of overdose.


Connect clients to harm reduction services including but not limited to naloxone training and kits, fentanyl and xylazine test strips, etc.


Refer clients for PCP visits at least once during the engagement period.


Complete and document care plan activities and progress notes in online platform.


Ensure all client information documented in online system is accurate and complete.


Track outreach, enrollment, services activity and conduct Social Determinant of Health (SDoH) assessments and make referrals to treatment and recovery services.


Ensure each client signs appropriate documentation, including consents.


Participate in biweekly meetings to review outreach, enrollment, and services activities and performance metrics, and in monthly case conferences to discuss and share best practices; receive updates related to outcomes monitoring.


Qualifications:

* High School Diploma/GED required.
* One year of recovery time and**CRPA/Certification as a Recovery Peer Advocate**(Substance Abuse) required, or**CRPA-p.**
* Experience with outreach and substance use disorder (SUD) clients.
* Must be willing to disclose lived experiences in mental health, substance abuse, and/or criminal justice.
* Must be able to navigate the public transportation system.
* Bilingual Spanish/English a plus.
* Must have exceptional communication skills both orally and in writing, with individuals and groups regarding complex and sensitive issues.

title: Clinical Director
description:
**About Us**

We are a behavioral health group specializing in substance use disorder and co-occurring issues. Our facility strives to provide the highest quality of care using evidence-based treatment modalities, medical staff, and licensed clinical professionals. Our mission is to help those that are struggling with mental health and substance use disorders develop the tools to recover, regain control, and live healthy, happy lives in long term recovery.

Our organization is committed to making a positive impact on the lives of individuals facing mental health and substance use challenges. As a leader in the healthcare industry, we strive to create an environment where compassionate care, innovation, and professional growth converge. Empowering lives through exceptional healthcare, we aim to be at the forefront of mental health and substance abuse treatment. By fostering a culture of inclusivity, empathy, and continuous improvement, we envision a world where every individual has access to high-quality, personalized care.

**Join Our Team**

The Clinical Director is responsible for management of all clinical functions of the facility and treatment services. The Clinical Director is also responsible for providing effective leadership to the clinical staff, has knowledge of the organization, provides marketing support for the facility, and directs all activities within the facility in accordance with standards of State and Federal regulations.

**Benefits**

In addition to competitive pay, we offer quality health insurance, dental and vision, paid time off, and more. We believe in the growth and success of our team to support our mission of helping our clients.

**Requirements**

To be considered for this position, you'll need:

* Masters degree in applicable field
* NJ Clinical License
* Clinical experience in substance abuse treatment required
* 2 years clinical supervisory experience
* Flexibility with schedule

**Responsibilites**

* Execute clinical philosophy in programming through effective clinical curriculum, education, training, and clinical supervision and ensure that staff performance and client experience is consistent with highest standard of care
* Direct management and supervision of Clinical Department including Primary Therapists, Clinical Supervisors, Case Managers, Group Facilitators and BHTs
* Oversee the departments compliance with legal policies, guidelines and standards
* Ensure all medical records and other hospital documentation are current and within state and federal laws
* Manages budgets and stays within budgeting allocations and develops cost-effective methods to provide services with effective and efficient staffing
* Demonstrates adaptability and flexibility to changes in the work environment.
* Provides a safe and therapeutic environment to all staff and patients.
* Performs other tasks, as assigned.

Pay: $100,000-150,000

Schedule: Full-time

Location: Eatontown, NJ

**Apply Today!**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Addiction Medicine
* Psychiatry

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Master's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Substance use disorder: 1 year (Preferred)
* Clinical supervisory: 1 year (Preferred)

* NJ Clinical License (Preferred)
* Clinical supervisory cert (Preferred)

title: Outside Sales Representative
description:
**Drywall Doctor** is a top-quality wall and ceiling repair service for residential and commercial properties in Central, New Jersey. The leadership team at Drywall Doctor has successfully scaled companies in the past and this is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of this startup company. As we continue to grow and expand our presence in the market, we are seeking a motivated and results-driven **Field Sales Representative** to join our team and drive business growth through strategic sales initiatives. We offer a competitive commission structure for our Field Sales Representatives.

As a **Field Sales Representative** at Drywall Repair, you will play a key role in generating new business opportunities and expanding our customer base within Central, NJ. You will be responsible for business-to-business sales, prospecting and qualifying leads, developing relationships with potential clients, and closing sales to meet revenue targets.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Identify and qualify leads through cold calling, networking events, and online research.
* Build relationships with contractors, electricians, HVAC technicians, and other skilled trades professionals.
* Build and maintain strong business relationships.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to develop sales campaigns.
* Identify growth opportunities in the Central, NJ market.
* Maintain accurate sales and operational records using CRM software.
* Provide regular updates on sales performance and market insights.

**About you:** 

* Excited about working in a startup environment with a fast-growing company
* 3+ years of B2B, Outside Sales experience
* Proven track record of attaining goals and exceeding quotas
* Solid computer skills including CRM Systems and MS Office
* Local to the Central New Jersey area
* Drivers license in good standing as well as a reliable vehicle
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* You enjoy meeting new people and building relationships!

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* This is a Base + Salary position
* Residual commissions on the relationships you build and nurture

title: Loan Processor Fulltime In Office
description:
**Mortgage Loan Processor**

We are a quickly growing mortgage broker with an IMMEDIATE need for a seasoned residential mortgage loan processor. Your part in the process will be assisting with gathering all mortgage loan documents and working as the liaison between our Lenders and borrowers; helping them to get the best rate they can and working with them to clear issues from the preliminary application right through to closing date!

We are looking for an efficient, professional and personable loan processor to manage our files and help clients navigate through the mortgage process, from start to finish. You will be responsible for gathering all necessary documentation, reviewing the package, working with the lenders' underwriters to understand and clear any issues or contingencies as well as helping to find competitive loan rates with our lenders.

To do well in this position, we need someone who is highly detail oriented, has amazing customer focus and be able to work with competing priorities. Excellent communication skills (written and oral) are key. Bilingual in Chinese and English is preferred.

**Responsibilities**

* Perform a general evaluation of an application (financial documents, mortgage type etc.)
* Gather all important data from client (assets, debts etc.)
* Verify information and references by contacting the right sources
* Submit completed loan files for approval
* Act as point of contact between underwriter and loan officers
* Conduct a final review of the file before closing

**Requirements**

* 5 years’ experience as a mortgage loan processor or similar position
* Understanding of loan underwriting and processing procedures
* Knowledge of mortgage laws and customary practices
* Proficient in mortgage loan computer software (e.g. Calyx Point/Encompass)
* Outstanding communication and customer service skills
* Excellent attention to detail

**Preferred (not required)**

* Bilingual (Chinese and English)

title: Cashier
description:
***We are looking for an Experienced Cashier to join our family-owned Italian grocery and help us process customer transactions. If youre interested, we would love to hear from you!***

Applicant must have CASHIER EXPERIENCE.


Apply ONLY if interested in LONG-TERM Position.

**We offer:** Competitive pay Medical Insurance Health Reimbursement Account Dental Insurance Vision Insurance A variety of income protection insurance programs (Disability, Term Life, Critical Illness, Accident), Paid Time Off 401k with Employer Match Generous Employee Discount *(Benefits vary depending on hours regularly scheduled to work.)*


The Cashier contributes to the companys operation and success by assisting customers and maintaining a clean and tidy checkout area while providing exceptional customer interaction. Attributes that contribute to success in this role include strong interpersonal skills, being proficient at basic math, and being trustworthy and transparent.

**The Cashiers duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* Managing the register and handling cash, credit/debit, check, and gift card transactions with customers.
* Scanning goods and utilizing scale to weigh items and ensure prices are accurate.
* Processing coupons and applying discounts and promotions when applicable.
* Sorting and bagging goods so as not to contaminate other goods and ensure they are safe for transport.
* Following store procedures regarding purchase of specialty items such as alcohol and cigarettes.
* Counting and balancing money in cashier drawer before and after shift.
* Remaining courteous and helpful to all customers and resolving complaints in a pleasant manner.
* Reporting all safety risks or issues, and illegal activity (including theft or fraud) to management.
* Returning unwanted items to shelves.

**The Cashiers work hours vary and will consist of day shifts (8:00 AM - 2:00 PM).**

**The ideal candidate for the Cashier position:**

* Has previous experience in a retail grocery store or as a cashier.
* Possesses basic math skills.
* Possesses strong customer service and communication skills.
* Is comfortable standing for long periods of time.
* Is punctual, reliable, and can adhere to a regularly assigned work schedule.

title: School RN| Full-Time - Roslyn
description:
**Job Posting: School Registered Nurse (RN) and Receptionist**

**Position Title:** School Registered Nurse (RN) and Receptionist

**Location:** Roslyn, NY

**Hourly Rate:** $40/hr

**Employment Type:** Full-Time

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a dedicated and versatile School Registered Nurse (RN) who will also serve as a receptionist. This unique role requires a compassionate and organized individual who can manage both clinical responsibilities and front-desk duties with equal proficiency. If you are a skilled RN with excellent communication and multitasking abilities, we invite you to apply and join our dynamic educational community.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Clinical Duties:**

* Provide direct care to students, including health assessments, first aid, and emergency care.
* Manage student health records and ensure compliance with state and federal regulations.
* Administer medications and treatments as prescribed.
* Develop and implement individualized healthcare plans for students with chronic conditions.
* Conduct health screenings and promote wellness programs within the school.
* Serve as a liaison between the school, families, and healthcare providers.

**Reception Duties:**

* Greet and assist students, parents, staff, and visitors in a professional and friendly manner.
* Manage phone calls, schedule appointments, and handle inquiries.
* Maintain the reception area, ensuring it is clean, organized, and welcoming.
* Perform administrative tasks, including data entry, filing, and managing correspondence.
* Assist with the coordination of school events and activities.

**Qualifications:**

* Current and valid Registered Nurse (RN) license.
* Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Nursing from an accredited institution.
* Previous experience in a school or pediatric setting is preferred.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
* Proficient in using electronic medical records (EMR) and office management software.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* CPR and First Aid certification.
* Flexible availability between 7am and 6pm.
