title: Cardiovascular Sales Specialist - Manhattan, NY- 2992457
description:
IQVIA, in partnership with our client, is looking for high performing sales representatives to join our team! We are looking for high energy, drive and passionate people.

  

The **Cardiovascular Sales Representative** will be responsible for supporting a major pharmaceutical company to provide education of disease state awareness and treatment options while maintaining and growing customer relationships in the cardiovascular marketplace. The position requires someone with a strong business acumen that can work in a team environment.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum of a bachelor’s degree required
* Minimum of 2 years pharmaceutical or biopharmaceutical field sales experience required
* Minimum of 1 year of cardiovascular sales experience required
* Experience preparing and executing business plans for targeted prospecting areas
* Experience working within a team environment
* Documented history of successful sales performance in a competitive environment
* Strong relationship building skills and the ability to identify key decision makers. Develops new business by initiating and sustaining strong, trusting relationships with HCPs and non-target HCPs (i.e. physicians, NPs, PAS, etc.)
* Consistently utilizes all available resources to monitor and manage business
* Valid driver's license and the ability to travel as necessary, including overnights and/or weekends (Approximate travel up to 50-70% of the time)
* Must live with in assigned geography

**Additional Requirements:**

* Demonstrate high collaborative skill sets within a team environment
* Entrepreneurial spirit and drive
* Opportunistic and finds ways to win in ambiguous environments
* Demonstrated business acumen
* Demonstrated analytical skills
* Demonstrated success in persuasion, influence, and promoting disease awareness.
* Support educational opportunities for HCPs within the community, and conduct HCP profiling to support demand generating commercial roles
* Demonstrated leadership ability
* Demonstrated ability to apply technical/scientific knowledge
* Flexibility and adaptability
* Initiative and execution-oriented
* Strong cross-functional teamwork skills


As the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our people help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product's value to payers, physicians and patients. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma's sales force to physicians or, providing therapy area educational input to physicians and patients. With the right experience, you can help deliver medical breakthroughs in the real world.


IQVIA offers a friendly, progressive work atmosphere and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance and vision coverage, tuition assistance, bonus plan and 401(k).


We look forward to the prospect of working with you!

**EEO Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled**

**#LI-CES**


IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com


We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all, including veterans and candidates with disabilities. https://jobs.iqvia.com/eoe


IQVIA’s ability to operate and provide certain services to customers and partners necessitates IQVIA and its employees meet specific requirements regarding COVID-19 vaccination status. https://jobs.iqvia.com/covid-19-vaccine-status


The potential base pay range for this role is $95,000 - $110,000 annually. The actual base pay offered may vary based on a number of factors including job-related qualifications such as knowledge, skills, education, and experience; location; and/or schedule (full or part-time). Dependent on the position offered, incentive plans, bonuses, and/or other forms of compensation may be offered, in addition to a range of health and welfare and/or other benefits.

* Buildingrelationships with and partner with T-Mobile employees across channels.
* Engagingwithfellow Archers and the T-Mobile brand through social media and neighborhood events.

**The ideal candidate will bring:**

* A strong desire to learn and master the skills required of ourteammatesand to build meaningful connections with our customers.
* Competitive drive and demonstrates the confidence to succeed in a fast-paced sales environment.
* Willingness to work alongside peers and store leaders, learning and sharing best practices, while serving customers and providing resolutions to issues.
* Effective at balancing customer experience and performance goals.
* 6 months of customer service and/or sales experience, retail environment preferred.

* Be at least 18 years ofage.
* High school degree or GED
* Ability to stand for long periods oftime.
* Ability to lift objects weighing up to 25lbs.
* Reliable transportation
* Full Time (40 hours) or Part Time (20+ hours) availability

* Uncappedearning potential
* Career growth and advancement

Employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences allow us to better reflect the communities whom we serve and result in a superior customer and employee experience. title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
Position Summary:


Our Therapy Aides are valued members of our clinic team. They ensure the equipment and clinic remain safe and clean for our patients, provide support to our front office team such as answering phones, collecting copays, checking in patients, and communicating with the patients and their family members. This is a great opportunity for students who are pursuing exercise science, physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy or anyone who loves being in healthcare and helping others.
Join Ivy Rehab’s dedicated team where you’re not just an employee, but a valued teammate! Together, we provide world-class care in physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, and applied behavior analysis (ABA) services. Our culture promotes authenticity, inclusion, growth, community, and a passion for exceptional care for every patient.


Job Description:

**Physical Therapy Aide**

Why Choose Ivy?

* **Best Employer:** A prestigious honor to be recognized by Modern Healthcare, signifying excellence in our industry and providing an outstanding workplace culture.
* **Innovative** **Resources & Mentorship:** Access to abundant resources, robust mentorship, and career advice for unparalleled success.
* **Professional Development:** Endless opportunities for career advancement through training programs centered on administrative excellence and leadership development.
* **Exceeding Expectations:** Deliver best-in-class care and witness exceptional patient outcomes.
* **Incentives Galore:** Eligibility for full benefits package beginning within your first month of employment. Generous PTO (Paid Time Off) plans, paid holidays, and bonus incentive opportunities.
* **Exceptional Partnerships:** Collaborate with leaders like Hospital for Special Surgery (HSS) to strive for excellence in patient care.
* **Empowering Values:** Live by values that prioritize teamwork, growth, and serving others.
  

 Position Qualifications:

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a positive attitude.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and bedside manner.
* Outstanding time management and ability to multi-task.
* Proven exceptional customer service and patient care experience.
* Self-motivated with the drive to exceed patient expectations.
* Flexibility to work varied shifts and possible weekends.
*We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of the recruiting and employment process. Actual salaries depend on a variety of factors, including experience, specialty, education, and organizational need. Any listed salary range or contractual rate does not include bonuses/incentive, differential pay, or other forms of compensation or benefits.*

title: Crew
description:
**Is it you?**  

Our Crew Members create a warm and friendly shopping experience in our stores. We answer questions, offer suggestions, and ensure our customers know they are welcomed and cared for. We entertain customers and make grocery shopping an exciting adventure.


Some responsibilities may include:

* Working on teams to accomplish goals
* Operating the cash register in a fun and efficient manner
* Bagging groceries with care
* Stocking shelves
* Creating signage to inform and delight customers
* Helping customers find their favorite products


You'll learn a lot. You're not stuck doing one task here. Each Crew Member contributes to creating a WOW customer experience by participating in all aspects of the job.


If you have experience in art including penmanship, working with chalk, and large signage, that's a plus.


If you have a passion for people and a fervor for food, we'd love to meet you. We can teach you the rest.


Stores have the greatest need for people that can work evenings and weekends.


Trader Joe's is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse Crew.

title: Emergency Medical Technician - EMT
description:
**Title:** Emergency Medical Technician

**Pay Rate:** $21 - $23 per hour

**Location:** 30 Jefferson Ave. Saint James, NY 11780

**Employment Type:** Full-Time & Part-Time Available

**Schedule:**

* 10 & 12 hours shifts
* 36 - 40 hours a week for Full-Time
* 12 - 24 hours a week for Part-Time
* Monday thru Sunday - Weekend availability is required

**Benefits:**

* **Sign-on Bonus for Full-Time new hires of up to $3,000.**
* **Referral Bonus when recommending a full-time candidate that is hired of up to $1,500.**
* **401K,****Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance (with company contribution), paid time off for full-time employees.**
* **$2.00 differential for overnight and weekend shifts.**

**Qualifications:**

* High School degree or equivalent.
* Valid NYS Driver’s license.
* Valid New York State Emergency Medical Technician certification.
* Valid American Heart Association Basic Life Support certification or equivalent.
* Excellent verbal communication skill.
* Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19.
* Must Have Friday & Saturday availability.

**Responsibilities:**

* Must be able to lift, push and pull 125lbs or more.
* Prepare and submit a pre-hospital patient care report.
* Gather patient billing information and appropriate billing signatures.
* Respond promptly to assignments as required by the Dispatch Center.
* Transport patients in accordance with outlined policies and procedures.
* Maintain rig cleanliness by stocking the rigs and taking ownership of your space.
* Collaborate with your fellow EMTs and management to assure top tier patient care.
* Operate and drive ambulance in conjunction with applicable safety policies and laws.
* Be flexible as emergency services operate on a 24-hour clock - your work shift schedule may vary due to the nature of the business.
* Conduct yourself in a courteous, helpful, and professional manner when dealing with patients, co-workers, supervisors, and the public.
* Recognize and treat any medical condition with appropriate techniques, equipment, and knowledge of all State and County protocols.
* Remain up to date with current standards of care, including equipment functions and uses and all certifications, licenses, and registrations.
* Provide top tier medical transport to medical facilities by assuming responsibilities for medical care of the patient and carrying out established policies and procedures.

**About Ambulnz by DocGo:**


Ambulnz by DocGo is leading the proactive healthcare revolution with an innovative care delivery platform that includes mobile health services, population health, remote patient monitoring, and ambulance services. DocGo disrupts the traditional four-wall healthcare system by providing high quality, highly affordable care to patients where and when they need it. DocGo's proprietary, AI-powered technology, logistics network, and dedicated field staff of over 5,000 certified health professionals elevate the quality of patient care and drive efficiencies for municipalities, hospital networks, and health insurance providers. With Mobile Health, DocGo empowers the full promise and potential of telehealth by facilitating healthcare treatment, in tandem with a remote physician, in the comfort of a patient's home or workplace. Together with DocGo's integrated Ambulnz medical transport services, DocGo is bridging the gap between physical and virtual care.


EEO/AAP Statement: DocGo is an equal opportunity employer. We acknowledge and honor the fundamental value and dignity of all individuals. We pledge ourselves to crafting and maintaining an environment that respects diverse traditions, heritages, and experiences. DocGo is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

*The above-noted job description is not intended to describe, in detail, the multitude of tasks that may be assigned but rather to give the applicant a general sense of the responsibilities and expectations of this position. As the nature of business demands change so, too, may the essential functions of the position.*

title: Server
description:
***About Corner Table***


Corner Table Restaurants (CTR), the company behind The Smith, has a simple mission: make people happy. We are passionate about taking great care of our employees, our guests, and our community. We are obsessed with building a positive, empowering, and supportive culture. By working closely with local farmers and purveyors that we trust, CTR serves delicious food and drinks people crave to millions of guests each year. With many more locations launching in the coming years, our team is growing fast, and we’re looking for smart, upbeat, authentic people to join us!

***About The Smith***


The Smith is an extremely popular casual neighborhood brasserie – in fact, several of our locations are among the Top 100 busiest restaurants in the US! The menu features bistro classics, seasonal fare, and craft cocktails. Our signature lively atmosphere makes The Smith a versatile setting for an after-work bite, drinks on the town, a birthday bash, a working lunch, a bountiful brunch, or an I-don’t-want-to-cook-tonight night.

**The Position: Server**

* **Must have full weekend availability**
* Serve all Smith guests by being attentive throughout the entire length of their meal.
* Create a welcoming environment for guests.
* Say yes! Always try to find a way to accommodate a request.
* Guide guests through their experience by offering specials, recommending cocktails, and providing suggestions
* Pay special attention to all dietary restrictions by informing the kitchen
* Observe the entire dining experience ensuring that every meal and every moment exceeds expectations.
* Take orders from guests and input them into the point of sale.
* List ingredients or common allergens for guests from memory
* Pay special attention to all dietary restrictions by informing the kitchen
* Observe the entire dining experience ensuring that every meal and every moment exceeds expectations.

**What Makes You Great:**

* You exemplify the highest standards of honesty and integrity.
* You are highly confident in your abilities and are detail-oriented.
* You are a team player and have excellent communication skills.
* You genuinely get joy out of making people happy and are able to have fun while working
* You have a love and passion for the hospitality industry.
* Learning about food and beverage excites you.
* You are willing to go above and beyond to please guests.
* You have previous serving experience.

**What Makes Us Great:**

* Competitive salary
* Bonus opportunity
* Comprehensive benefits plan, including medical, dental, vision and life insurance
* 401K plan with company match
* Employee Assistance Program
* Gym Discounts
* Commuter benefits
* Bring a friend to work bonus
* Generous paid time off
* A great environment to work in surrounded by talented, hardworking, passionate, and fun people.

*Pay: $16.00/hr + Tips*

***Statement of Diversity***


At Corner Table Restaurants, each person brings their own perspectives and experiences. We strive to create an environment that is consciously inclusive, psychologically, and physically safe and ensures everyone can be heard and valued. Diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace are essential to living our Core Values. We create and promote a culture that advocates for the equality of everyone, and it is our mission to continually maintain an environment where all our team members and guests belong, are respected, and thrive while being their best authentic selves.

*Corner Table Restaurants is an Equal Opportunity Employer*

title: Prevailing Wage Concierge - Watermark LIC
description:
**ABOUT GREYSTAR**


Greystar is a leading, fully integrated global real estate company offering expertise in property management, investment management, development, and construction services in institutional-quality rental housing, logistics, and life sciences sectors. Headquartered in Charleston, South Carolina, Greystar manages and operates more than $290 billion of real estate in 247 markets globally with offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and the Asia-Pacific region. Greystar is the largest operator of apartments in the United States, manages more than 857,400 units/beds globally, and has a robust institutional investment management platform comprised of more than $76 billion of assets under management, including over $34 billion of development assets. Greystar was founded by Bob Faith in 1993 to become a provider of world-class service in the rental residential real estate business. To learn more, visit www.greystar.com.

 **JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY**


Organizes, coordinates, and implements various resident services and programs and acts as an information source for and help to residents related to local market resources.**JOB DESCRIPTION**

* Greets prospects and residents as they enter the office/leasing area, and ensure the comforts of prospects and visitors while they wait to speak with a team member.
* Answers phone calls, routes all calls to the appropriate team member for assistance, and assists with completed service request call backs as necessary.
* Maintains the guest suite schedule to ensure proper payment and cleanliness upon guest arrival and manages and coordinates the loading dock and/or elevator schedule for move-ins and move-outs.
* Ensures clubhouse amenities are in tour condition prior to leasing office opening each morning.
* Manages all package deliveries by documenting arrival information and notifying residents of all package deliveries within 24 hours.
* Maintains tracking logs for equipment rentals, dry cleaning services, and/or other services provided by the community.
* Assists the community team with scheduling, planning and organizing resident activities and programs.
* Keeps detailed information on local area restaurants, shops, delivery places, and other pertinent information that may be of interest to residents and maintains relationships and contacts with concierge vendors


#LI-SV


The hourly range for this position is $21.58 - $21.58

**Additional Compensation**:

* *Corporate Positions*: In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible to participate in an annual bonus program based on individual and company performance.
* *Onsite Property Positions*: In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible to participate in weekly, monthly, and/or quarterly bonus programs.

**Robust Benefits Offered\\*:**

* Competitive Medical, Dental, Vision, and Disability & Life insurance benefits. Low (free basic) employee Medical costs for employee-only coverage; costs discounted after 3 and 5 years of service.
* Generous Paid Time off. All new hires start with 15 days of vacation, 4 personal days, 10 sick days, and 10 paid holidays. Plus your birthday off after 1 year of service! Additional vacation accrued with tenure.
* For onsite team members, 20-40% housing discount at Greystar-managed communities.
* 6-Week Paid Sabbatical after 10 years of service (and every 5 years thereafter).
* 401(k) with Company Match up to 6% of pay after 6 months of service.
* Paid Parental Leave and lifetime Fertility Benefit reimbursement up to $10,000 (includes adoption or surrogacy).
* Employee Assistance Program.
* Critical Illness, Accident, Hospital Indemnity, Pet Insurance and Legal Plans.
* Charitable giving program and benefits.

* *Benefits offered for full-time employees. For Union and Prevailing Wage roles, compensation and benefits may vary from the* *listed information* *above due to Collective Bargaining Agreements and/or local governing authority.*


Greystar will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Lease- Up Community Manager - Union County, NJ
description:
**ABOUT GREYSTAR**


Greystar is a leading, fully integrated global real estate company offering expertise in property management, investment management, development, and construction services in institutional-quality rental housing, logistics, and life sciences sectors. Headquartered in Charleston, South Carolina, Greystar manages and operates more than $290 billion of real estate in 247 markets globally with offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and the Asia-Pacific region. Greystar is the largest operator of apartments in the United States, manages more than 857,400 units/beds globally, and has a robust institutional investment management platform comprised of more than $76 billion of assets under management, including over $34 billion of development assets. Greystar was founded by Bob Faith in 1993 to become a provider of world-class service in the rental residential real estate business. To learn more, visit www.greystar.com.

 **JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY**


Manages the day-to-day operations of an assigned property including managing the team members, daily activities, and resources of the property to achieve established budgeted financial and operational goals, and ensures that the operation of the property complies with Company policies and procedures, Fair Housing, Americans with Disabilities Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, and other laws and regulations governing multi-family housing operations.  

  

* Lease-Up experience preferred
* Strong Communication and Leasing Skills: be able to communicate with new residents, team members, and ownership to build relationships, resolve issues, and provide outstanding customer service.
* Strong Leadership Skills to lead and motivate the team to reach budgeted goals and foster a positive work environment
* Financial Acumen: a strong understanding of budgeting and financial reporting
* Organization skills to manage multiple tasks and the demands of a lease-up community.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

* Provides input into the development of budget(s) for the property by analyzing and evaluating financial statements, reviewing current and projected marketing information, and accessing operational reports that establish historic and predict performance patterns.
* Meets targeted revenues by setting rent rates, ensuring rent and fees are collected and posted in a timely manner, making financial bank deposits, and preparing and reviewing monthly financial status reports.
* Approves invoices from vendors, contractors, and service providers for payment by reconciling work performed or products purchased, ensuring validity of certificates of insurance, coding charges to appropriate Chart of Account codes, and managing communication between the vendor/contractor, accounting, and the client/owner as needed.
* Controls expenditures by staying within the constraints of the approved budget and manages the balance and maintenance of the petty cash fund.
* Oversees the lease enforcement process by approving prospective resident applications, discounts and renewal leases, conducts periodic apartment inspections, follows proper notice requirements, evicts residents, and imposes and collects late fees and other charges as allowable and stated in the terms of the lease.
* Gathers, analyzes, and interprets current market and economic trends that may impact the property and implements short- and long-range marketing and leasing strategies to achieve the property’s occupancy and revenue goals.
* Promotes resident satisfaction and retention by responding to complaints, questions, and requests in a timely manner, and taking appropriate action to resolve and address service issues. Ensures the property’s maintenance team members comply with the Company’s standards with respect to responding and completing resident service requests.
* Conducts regular property inspections and takes appropriate actions to ensure that the physical aspects of the property, grounds, buildings, and amenities meet established standards for safety, cleanliness, and general appearance and appeal.
* Community Manager Supervises property staff by interviewing, hiring, orienting, and training employees, and manages their performance in accordance with Company policies, values, and business practices.
* Assists in managing the client/owner relationship by meeting with the owners, conducting property tours, providing updates and information about the property’s performance, and responding to owner requests as needed.

title: Dental Billing Specialist
description:
We seek a highly organized, adaptable, and experienced Dental Billing Specialist for our six practices in Brooklyn and Queens.


The Dental Billing Specialist is responsible for achieving the revenue targets of the practice. This person must have prior dental billing experience and be familiar with Government and Commercial Insurance plans.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Develop and Implement effective billing/collection policies and procedures
* Ensure compliance with government and third-party regulations
* Optimize insurance payer contract, pricing, and reimbursement rates
* Oversee timely claim submission and manage the aging process minimizing denials
* Conduct pre- and post-appointment audits
* Handle insurance calls and facilitate the correction of claims/refunds

 **Qualifications:**

* Strong knowledge of third party financing; Lending Club, Alphaeon, Care Credit, etc.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent critical thinking and organizational skills
* Positive attitude and strong problem-solving abilities

 **General Skills:**

* Proficiency in data entry and analysis
* Strong interpersonal skills and teamwork
* Ability to multitask and manage projects effectively


Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Dental Patient Relations Specialist
description:
Join our team as a Patient Relations Specialist, enhancing patient experience across our offices in Brooklyn and Queens. Join a team that is focued on delivery the best patient experience to ensure that our patients keep returning for their oral health care.


Key Responsibilities:

**Enhance Patient Experience:** Resolve patient feedback and concerns promptly and efficiently via phone, text, and email.

**Conflict Resolution:** Own and manage all patient feedback programs, working closely with team. Implement strategies to resolve conflicts and enhance patient satisfaction.

**Analytics:** Collaborate with the team to develop reporting mechanisms and communication processes. Identify performance improvement opportunities for team members.

**Patient Satisfaction:** Work with all departments to set and communicate performance expectations related to patient experience. Design and execute initiatives to enhance the overall patient experience.


Experience & Skills  



  

**Experience:**

* Minimum 5 years in a dental office setting.
* Proficiency in Dentrix Ascend, Google Workspace, Slack, Asana, and ADA billing guidelines.
* Knowledge of dental insurances, including PPO, DMO, DHMO (Capitation), and NYS Managed Care Programs
* Understanding of in-network/out-of-network benefits and fee-for-service models.
* Familiarity with general dentistry and orthodontics procedures and treatments.


**Technical Skills:**

* Proficient in data entry and analysis, with experience using Excel and other similar programs.

**Soft Skills:**

  

* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* High attention to detail.
* Outstanding organizational and multitasking skills.


Requirements:

 **Remote Work:**

* High-speed internet and a dedicated workspace to ensure productivity.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality regarding sensitive issues.


Why Join Us?

  

If you're organized, detail-oriented, and passionate about improving patient experiences, we want to hear from you! Join a team dedicated to providing safe and compassionate care, building strong patient relationships, and fostering a supportive work environment.


Take the next step in your career and help us make a difference in our patients' lives. Apply now to become a key part of our dynamic team!

  

Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Orthodontic Assistant - Brooklyn Based
description:
At NYFD, we are a trailblazing company at the forefront of dentistry. We foster a collaborative and inclusive work culture, encouraging fresh ideas and empowering our employees to achieve their full potential. As an orthodontic assistant you will play a pivotal role in driving our continued success. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the organizational workflow and work alongside a team of talented professionals who are dedicated to pushing boundaries and delivering exceptional results.

* taking their medical history, explaining the treatment process, and addressing any concerns or questions they may have.

* should adhere to strict infection control protocols, sterilize instruments, clean treatment areas, and maintain a safe and hygienic working environment.
* should maintain patient records, update treatment progress notes, and document any necessary information related to the procedures performed.
* educate patients on proper oral hygiene practices, including brushing, flossing, and caring for their orthodontic appliances. They should also provide instructions on the use of orthodontic appliances and answer any questions related to treatment.

  


**Why Join New York Family Dentistry:**

title: Process Improvement Lead
description:
### **Join Laundrylux**

### **Process Improvement Lead**

#### **What we are looking for:**


Laundrylux has a small team of employees called “Customer Care Account Managers” that are responsible for coordinating with sales, order entry, finance, logistics, and accounting to facilitate orders being shipped on time and in-full. The current process is manual, cumbersome, and slow which is frustrating to all people involved.

### **Position Objective:**

We are looking for an analytical leader that can help us rethink the current processes and support the implementation of new, streamlined processes. The successful candidate will function as a Customer Care Account Manager for 3 months, then begin leading projects that will optimize the process by simplifying and automating steps in the order-to-cash process. The goal will be to have the complete process in 12 months, at which time, this person will lead the department. The person that fills this role will work directly for the COO and have his full support.


Before we continue to dive into the requirements for the role let’s talk about **Why you should join Laundrylux?**

 **Career Advancement:** We offer a career, not just a job. We invest in the personal and professional growth of every employee because we believe growth leads to both business impact and personal fulfillment.

**Learning and Development:** We foster a culture that encourages and promotes professional growth and development, with continuous learning

**Diversity Initiatives**: We are proud to have launched the Women’s Initiative focused on building a better workplace for women, providing support, and recognizing the talented women within our company.

#### **Laundrylux Benefits****:**

* We offer a comprehensive health benefits package including medical and dental plans as well as 401(k) and so much more! Ask our recruiting team for more information.


Back to the role:

#### **What you will do:**

* Spend 3 months learning the current Customer Care Account Manager’s responsibilities and processes.
* Validate the current process maps that have been created and edit where appropriate.
* Support the implementation of the new ERP module that will simplify the quoting process for the sales team. Ensure it meets all requirements of the Customer Care team. Requirements to be learned during your training.
* Identify and develop requirements for the IT team to automate processes or write Visual Basic/Python code to automate the processes in the order-to-cash process.
* Optimize the customer care processes, people, and information flow to ensure all orders are ready to be shipped within 2 days of order entry.
* Develop metrics, dashboards, and a routine to review those metrics with the Customer Care team.

#### **What you should have:**

* 2+ years’ of consulting experience.
* Proficiency in data analysis- advanced Excel required, PowerBI, Visual Basic, and Python knowledge preferred.
* Ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
* Experience with process mapping and optimization
* Effective communication
* Excellent collaborator
* Problem solver – be resourceful and identify solutions to problems.
* Preferred experience in a manufacturing and/or distribution
* Preferred experience with ERP systems

#### **Salary Range:**


$100,000-$110,000 annually Depending on Experience

#### **Our Values:**


People, Share Responsibility, Integrity, Excellence, Customer Focused, Meaningfulness and Fun




If you are looking for your next challenge, then this is your chance to join our team of exceptionally talented, creative and innovative professionals. We want you!

  

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

  

Our company participates in E-Verify.

title: Seasonal Summer Flyer Distributor
description:
**Job Description:**


We are seeking enthusiastic and outgoing individuals to join our team as Seasonal Summer Flyer Distributors for our dental office. This short-term position is perfect for anyone who enjoys being outdoors, interacting with people, and promoting our office.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Sit outside our dental office and distribute flyers and promotional items with a bottle of water to passersby.
* Engage with individuals in a friendly and positive manner.
* Hand out promotional items and provide basic information about our dental services.
* Encourage people to visit our office for a free consultation.
* Direct interested individuals to the office upstairs to schedule appointments.
* Salary: $18 an hour

**Qualifications:**

* No prior experience required.
* Friendly, outgoing, and enthusiastic personality.
* Comfortable interacting with a diverse range of people.
* Reliable and punctual.
* Ability to stand for extended periods.
* Enjoy working outdoors in varying weather conditions.

title: Oral Surgeon - Part Time, Once a week!
description:
**Join Our Team at New York Family Dentistry: Experience the Future of Oral Health Care!**


New York Family Dentistry is excited to expand our services to include Oral Surgery alongside top-notch general dentistry. As our organization evolves, we're seeking passionate individuals to join us in making a difference in the lives of our patients.

**Why Join Us?**


* Earn a competitive salary ranging from $500,000 to $999,000 annually, with bonus incentives to reward your hard work and dedication.
* Access cutting-edge dental technology that empowers you to provide the highest quality care and stay at the forefront of your field.
* Serve a diverse and dynamic patient base in Brooklyn and Queens, including under-served populations, providing you with a rewarding and fulfilling experience.
* Make a meaningful impact by providing essential oral health care to those who may not otherwise have access to it, ensuring equitable treatment for all.
* Work alongside a dedicated support team focused on patient care, in a collaborative and nurturing environment that emphasizes team training and development.


**About the Role**


As a part-time Oral Surgeon at New York Family Dentistry, you'll have the opportunity to leverage your clinical expertise and interpersonal skills to provide exceptional oral health care. Join a team that prioritizes patient well-being and values effective collaboration among dental professionals.

**Ideal Candidate Qualities**


* Compassionate and patient-centric approach to care
* Strong communication skills and problem-solving aptitude
* Detail-oriented mindset with excellent time management and multitasking abilities


**Requirements**


* Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS) or Doctor of Dental Medicine (DMD) degree from an accredited dental school.
* Completion of an accredited oral and maxillofacial surgery residency program.
* Active state dental license, with specific licensure required for the state where the practice is located.
* Board certification or eligibility for certification by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery (ABOMS) or equivalent certification body.
* Proficiency in a wide range of oral surgical procedures, including but not limited to tooth extractions, dental implants, jaw surgeries, and oral pathology management.
* Experience in administering anesthesia and sedation for surgical procedures.
* Willingness to stay updated on advancements in oral and maxillofacial surgery techniques and technologies through continuing education and professional development activities.
* Compliance with all relevant legal and ethical standards in the practice of oral surgery.


**Ready to Join Us?**


If you're passionate about delivering high-quality dental care and thrive in a supportive and welcoming environment, we invite you to apply for our part-time Oral Surgeon position. To submit your application, please send your resume and cover letter. We eagerly anticipate hearing from you and welcoming you to our team!

title: Dental Receptionist
description:
Are you passionate about delivering exceptional patient hospitality and making a positive impact on people's lives? New York Family Dentistry (NYFD) is excited to offer a unique opportunity for a Dental Receptionist to join our family-oriented team.


At NYFD, we prioritize creating lifelong positive experiences for our patients while fostering a supportive, engaging, and collaborative work environment.

**Why join us as a Dental Receptionist**

**Patient Hospitality:** Make a difference in patients' lives by providing a warm, welcoming, and positive experience from the moment they walk through our doors.

**Family Work Environment:** Be part of a close-knit team that values collaboration, support, and mutual respect.

**Competitive Compensation** Base per hour plus bonus opportunities.

**Career Growth**: Gain opportunities to grow your skills and advance your career in the dental field.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Warm Welcome:** Greet patients warmly and ensure they feel valued from their first interaction.

**Patient Support:** Assist patients in completing essential documentation, ensuring accuracy and completeness.

**Scheduling Excellence** Manage appointment scheduling, adapt to rescheduling or cancellations, and maintain an organized schedule for our dental team.

**Effective Communication**: Communicate professionally, respectfully, and courteously with patients and colleagues, embodying our esteemed practice's essence.

**Professional Appearance:** Maintain a neat and professional appearance, reflecting our company's positive image.


**What We Offer**

**Impactful Role:** Join a company transforming the field of dentistry, where your role will make a significant difference.

**Innovative Environment:** Thrive in an environment where cutting-edge technology is the norm and collaborate with industry experts to pioneer groundbreaking solutions.

**Career Development:** We are dedicated to nurturing your growth with tailored opportunities for advancement and learning.

**Team Spirit:** Enjoy the camaraderie of a dedicated team and partake in spirited quarterly meetings, where your expertise will be appreciated and celebrated.

**Requirements:**

  

* Previous Medical/Dental Reception experience, focusing on patient hospitality.
* Experience with Dental Office Software is a plus (Dentrix, Ascend, Eagle Soft)
* Knowledge of Dental terminology and procedures
* Knowledge of Dental Insurances; PPO, HMO, DHMO, Managed Care
* High School diploma or equivalent
* Fluent in English; Bilingual skills, proficiency in Spanish is preferred and considered a valuable asset.

  

Salary: starting at $25 per hour depending on experience


Join us at New York Family Dentistry and become part of a dynamic team that values your experience and offers opportunities for personal and professional growth. Apply now to embark on the next step in your career!

title: General Dentist - Alternating Saturdays
description:
Join Our Team: Exceptional General Dentist Wanted!


Are you ready to elevate your dental career to new heights? New York Family Dentistry is on a mission to expand the scope of care we offer to our diverse patient community, and we're searching for an outstanding General Dentist to join our dynamic team!


Why Join Us?


At New York Family Dentistry, we're more than just a dental practice – we're a passionate team dedicated to delivering exceptional care and creating beautiful smiles. When you join our family, you'll enjoy:

* A high market-competitive salary of $900 a day guaranteed, plus an enticing bonus structure
* Transportation subsidy to make your commute hassle-free
* Supportive and patient-focused team members who are committed to your success
* Access to the latest advancements in dental technology to enhance your practice
* An extensive and diverse patient base in the vibrant neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens
* A warm and welcoming family atmosphere with a strong emphasis on team training and development

**About the Role**


As a General Dentist at New York Family Dentistry, you'll harness the power of your clinical expertise and warm personality to deliver outstanding oral health care and unforgettable patient experiences. This role requires a deep commitment to patient care and the ability to collaborate seamlessly with our talented dental team.


If You Have These Amazing Qualities, You're the Perfect Fit:

* Caring and compassionate demeanor that puts patients at ease
* Patience and empathy to address our patients' diverse needs and concerns
* Excellent communication skills to connect authentically with patients and colleagues
* Strong problem-solving abilities to tackle any dental challenge with confidence
* Detail-oriented approach to ensure precision and excellence in every procedure
* Stellar time management and multitasking skills to thrive in our fast-paced environment

**Requirements**

* DDS or DMD from an accredited dental school
* Completion of an accredited dentistry residency program
* Active New York State Dental License
* Ability to work alternating Saturdays


If you're passionate about providing top-notch dental care and crave a supportive and friendly work environment, then look no further – you've found your perfect job! Submit your application today, along with your resume and cover letter, and take the next step in your dental career with New York Family Dentistry.


Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to make a difference – apply now and become a valued member of our team! And yes, our ideal candidate must be available to work every Saturday – because creating smiles knows no weekend breaks!

title: Pediatric Dental Assistant - Brooklyn Based
description:
Are you passionate about providing quality dental care to children? Do you have a warm and friendly demeanor that puts young patients at ease? We have an exciting opportunity for a Pediatric Dental Assistant to join our dedicated team and make a positive impact on the oral health of our youngest patients.


At New York Family Dentistry, we are committed to delivering exceptional dental care in a comfortable and welcoming environment. Our team of professionals is dedicated to ensuring children have positive dental experiences, setting the foundation for a lifetime of good oral health.


As a Pediatric Dental Assistant, you will play a crucial role in providing support to our pediatric dentist and ensuring that each child's visit is smooth and enjoyable. Your responsibilities will include:

* Assisting the pediatric dentist during dental procedures, including examinations, cleanings, and treatments.
* Preparing treatment rooms and ensuring they are well-stocked and sanitized.
* Welcoming young patients and their families, helping to create a friendly and reassuring atmosphere.
* Educating children and their parents on proper oral hygiene techniques.
* Taking digital X-rays and maintaining accurate patient records.
* Sterilizing and maintaining dental instruments and equipment.
* Providing chairside assistance to the dentist, anticipating their needs and ensuring patient comfort.
* Offering support to children who may be anxious or nervous about dental procedures.
* Adhering to infection control protocols and maintaining a safe environment for patients and staff.
* Participating in team meetings and continuing education opportunities to stay up-to-date with best practices.

  


**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Completion of an accredited dental assisting program.
* Pediatric dental experience is preferred but not required; willingness to learn and work with children is essential.
* X-ray certification.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, especially when interacting with children and parents.
* Organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work effectively as part of a team.

  


**Benefits:** We offer a competitive compensation package along with the following benefits:

* Salary: $25-28ph depending on experience
* Benefits Package Available
* Convenient 4 Day Week Schedule giving you 3 days off to do what you love!
	+ Wednesday-Saturday
	+ Sunday-Wednesday

title: Patient Care Caller
description:
**Patient Care Caller**


Are you an organized, adaptable, and experienced communicator ready to make a difference in patient care? Join our team across five practices in Brooklyn and Queens as a Patient Care Caller.

**Responsibilities:**

* Reach out to patients via phone calls to follow up on their recent medical appointments or treatments.
* Listen attentively to patients' concerns, questions, and feedback regarding their care experience.
* Provide empathetic and knowledgeable responses to address patients' inquiries or escalate issues to appropriate personnel for resolution.
* Accurately and thoroughly document all interactions with patients in our database or electronic medical records system.
* Ensure compliance with all patient privacy and confidentiality regulations (e.g., HIPAA) during interactions.
* Participate in ongoing training to stay updated on healthcare procedures, policies, and best practices.
* Maintain a positive and supportive attitude towards patients, colleagues, and healthcare professionals.

  


**Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or training in healthcare or customer service is a plus.
* Proven experience in a customer service or patient care role, preferably in a healthcare setting.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, conveying empathy and professionalism over the phone.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport with patients from diverse backgrounds.
* Detail-oriented and organized, with multitasking and prioritization abilities.
* Proficiency in using computers and electronic medical records systems; familiarity with CRM software is advantageous.
* Ability to remain calm and composed in challenging or emotional situations.
* Commitment to upholding ethical standards and maintaining patient confidentiality.
* Flexibility to work shifts that may include evenings, weekends, or holidays based on operational needs.


Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Manufacturing Production Operator
description:
Job Title: Production Operator


Role & Responsibilities:

* Adhere to all safety/housekeeping requirements within a manufacturing setting.
* Responsible for operating production equipment, including troubleshooting and making the necessary adjustments to ensure product and quality specifications are met.
* Recording of production data and other results in the manner required.
* Apply basic maintenance skills to help service equipment.
* Expected to take an active role in all plant safety and continuous improvement initiatives as required by supervision.
* Adaptable to scheduling requirements including shiftwork, assignment of overtime, working weekends, etc. where applicable.


Qualifications & Requirements:

* Able to work in a manufacturing setting in a safe manner and follow all plant safety and housekeeping rules.
* Ability to learn to operate and troubleshoot plant equipment.
* Ability to interpret verbal and written work instructions.
* Ability to apply basic computer skills required for data entry and reporting.
* Proficiency at taking measurements as needed to verify product is within specifications.
* Possess basic maintenance skills, including familiarity with common hand tools and how to properly use them (Hammer, wrench, screwdrivers, pliers, putty knife, etc.).
* Effective teamwork and communication skills needed with all co-workers.
* Maintain regular and predictable attendance.

  

Rate of pay may be adjusted based on the qualifications and experience of the candidate.

  

USG employees enjoy a number of benefit options for themselves and their families. These include two medical insurance options, as well as vision and dental coverage. The cost of these optional programs varies based on coverage level - employees generally pay 25% of the monthly premium cost, USG pays the rest. These coverage options are offered on the first day of employment with no waiting period.

  

Additionally, USG employees enjoy both a 401(k) Investment Plan with company match and a pension plan. Beyond these main features, employees may also choose from a number of additional programs like life insurance, accident insurance, legal insurance, even pet insurance, just to name a few. USG also offers Quarterly (hourly) / Annual (salary) bonus potential for all employees based on performance metrics tied to safety, quality, and productivity. USG also provides employees with paid time off and paid holidays.

*Since 1902, Chicago-based USG has been a leader in producing innovative, award-winning products and systems to build everything from major commercial developments and residential housing to home improvements. USG's employees are committed to the highest levels of customer satisfaction and quality in everything we do. Our steadfast commitment to the company's core business values – innovation, quality, integrity, service, diversity, efficiency and safety – have helped us become the company we are today.*

  

*EOE including disability/veteran*
