title: Driver, Life Sciences
description:
At Biocair our Drivers are a truly vital part of our organisation. This is not just any driver role; it is not just any courier role. This is one of the most crucial roles in our company where what you do will make a true impact on someone's life. It is something you can be proud to be associated with. It is not about dropping 200 parcels in one day, it's about ensuring you transport a select number of time critical and temperature sensitive consignments (whether medicines or a sample from a cancer patient) in a safe, careful, and timely manner whilst maintaining the highest levels of customer care. This is a busy and fast paced role with customer care being at the centre of all you do.

**Responsibilities will include:**

* The preparation and packaging of all specialist packaging and temperature-controlled consignments including Ambient Packing”; “Refrigerated Packing”; Frozen Packing; “Dry Ice Packing”; “Infectious Substances Packing”; “Dangerous Goods Packing” and Liquid Nitrogen ensuring all mandatory procedures are adhered to.
* Building positive working relationships with other drivers, departments, and management to deliver excellent communication and customer service and working proactively to overcome problems and implement process improvements.
* Ensuring all the correct documentation is accurately completed and processed with the shipment.
* Performing duties to maintain a clean, tidy, and safe warehouse, ensuring all materials are stored in the designated areas as well as ensuring fridges, freezers and warm room temperatures are checked and remain within prescribed parameters and maintain accurate records thereof.
* Ensuring the cleanliness of the vehicles as well as carrying out daily and weekly vehicle maintenance checks and perform simple maintenance tasks as required.

Our company values matter, and guide all that we do each day. The successful candidate will be expected to operate in line with them as we strive to be the provider of choice for specialist logistics solutions to the global scientific community; based on the highest levels of **care**, **expertise** and **precision**; enabling our customers to retain absolute focus on research and development.**In addition, you will demonstrate these key competencies:**

* Excellent customer service skills.
* A full, clean driving license.
* Must have less than 2 moving violations within the last 24 months
* Physical ability to move/lift shipments of up to 75 lbs.
* Demonstrable experience of working well under time pressure as well as the ability to check and maintain accurate documentation.


**In return we offer:.**


* $25.00 per hour
* Bonus scheme
* Health, vision, and dental insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* 401K with generous match
* PTO


**Please note this is a full time role, 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday 08:00 to 16:30 working from Biocair's New York office (NY 11563).**



Biocair provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


All offered candidates are subject to pre-employment screening which includes a denied party background check, a motor vehicle records check, and an E-Verify work authorization check.

 **Please be aware that we are NOT inviting recruitment agencies to submit candidates for this role and as such any approaches will be rejected. Thank you for your understanding.**
company_description: Biocair is a global GDP logistics specialist with over 35 years of experience in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology and life sciences sectors.

title: Customer Care Account Manager
description:
### **Join Laundrylux**

**Customer Care Account Manager**

#### **What we are looking for:**


 As a Laundrylux Customer Care Account Manager, you are the primary point of contact for our distributors and customers supporting all brands within our market segments. Aligned with our Regional Business Development Managers, Financing Team, and Fulfillment team. The Customer Care Account Manager’s primary focus is to maintain ownership of all sales orders within a specified territory from order entry through to shipping and post-sale management. The Customer Care Account Manager must be able to collaborate and find resolutions that meet the customer and Laundrylux’s business objectives.


Before we continue to dive into the requirements for the role let’s talk about **Why you should join Laundrylux?**

**Career Advancement:** We offer a career, not just a job. We invest in the personal and professional growth of every employee because we believe growth leads to both business impact and personal fulfillment.

**Learning and Development:** We foster a culture that encourages and promotes professional growth and development, with continuous learning

**Diversity Initiatives**: We are proud to have launched the Women’s Initiative focused on building a better workplace for women, providing support, and recognizing the talented women within our company.

#### **Laundrylux Benefits****:**

* We offer a comprehensive health benefits package including medical and dental plans as well as 401(k) and so much more! Ask our recruiting team for more information.


Back to the role:

#### **What you will do:**

* Serve as primary point of contact for all customers in your territory by building and maintaining long-term strategic relationships with the Sales Team, customers, and inter-departmental teams.
* Enter and maintain detailed sales orders into Epicor including correct PNC’s (machines, parts, and ancillary), pricing, discounts, special sales programs, addresses, territory, mark for, order type, quantity, etc. This includes following up with customers regarding incomplete information or discrepancies on their POs.
* Maintain a shared inbox to monitor incoming orders and revisions and track pending requests. Acknowledge receipt of customer PO through email.
* Collaborate with the finance and accounting departments to get orders released in a timely manner.
* Work with Customers to understand their timelines, needs, and shipping requirements to process accordingly.
* Ensure on time shipment of customers’ orders by working with the Fulfillment and Operations Teams.
* Identify and proactively handle delivery delays.
* Arrange dock appointments with the Operations team and get BOLs once scheduled.
* Work with customers to resolve shipment issues, i.e., damages, missing parts, wrong parts sent.
* Provide weekly open order reports to customers and RBDMs.
* Provide freight quotes, inventory availability, and order status updates upon request.
* Process credits, debits, and RMAs as assigned.
* Identify the root cause of issues and offer viable solutions to improve our efficiency, accuracy, current sales support processes, and customer relationships.
* Answer the sales phone queue and assist customers or forward to the correct department for assistance.
* Uphold all Customer Care service level agreements.
* Perform other duties as assigned by management

#### **What you should have:**

* 3+ years professional Sales Support, Account Management or Order Management experience
+ Ability to work autonomously with little supervision
+ Ability to collaborate with internal departments positively and proactively
+ Excellent verbal and written skills
+ Ability to shift priorities in a fast-paced environment
+ Aptitude to learn new systems and processes
+ Proficiency in MS Office
+ Sales or logistics experience a plus
+ Bi-lingual a plus but not required

#### **Salary Range:**


$65,000-$75,000 Depending on Experience

#### **Our Values:**


People, Share Responsibility, Integrity, Excellence, Customer Focused, Meaningfulness and Fun

  



If you are looking for your next challenge, then this is your chance to join our team of exceptionally talented, creative and innovative professionals. We want you!

  

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

  

Our company participates in E-Verify.

title: Office Manager
description:
We are MPB, the largest global platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit. MPB is a destination for everyone, whether you’ve just discovered your passion for visual storytelling or you’re already a pro.


MPB has always been committed to making kit more accessible and affordable, and helping to visualise a more sustainable future. We recirculate more than 485,000 items of used kit every year, extending the life and creative potential of photo and video equipment for creators around the world.


Headquartered in the creative communities of Brighton, Brooklyn and Berlin, the MPB team includes trained camera experts and seasoned photographers and videographers who bring their passion to work every day to deliver outstanding service. Every piece of kit is inspected carefully by our product specialists and comes with a six-month warranty to give our customers peace of mind that buying used doesn’t mean sacrificing reliability.


MPB customers come from all walks of life, and so do we. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age. At MPB, every employee has the opportunity to make an impact and grow.

**The role**


MPB is hiring for an Office Manager to maintain and continue developing our creative and vibrant Brooklyn office. You will play a key role in maintaining our positive and collaborative atmosphere, and in ensuring the smooth day to day running of the office.


Alongside the day to day responsibilities, you’ll be involved in the ongoing development of the office space as we continue to grow and develop - which includes various exciting projects.

  

If you thrive on variety, and you’re looking for a job where you can have a direct impact and develop your career, then we want to hear from you!

 **What you’ll do day to day**

* Provide a feel-good atmosphere and ensure the smooth running of the office.
* Overseeing the maintenance of office facilities, including repairs, cleanliness, and ensuring a safe and efficient working environment.
* Serving as a point of contact between employees, management, and external stakeholders, and facilitating effective communication within the office.
* Conduct health and safety tasks and risk assessments.
* Ensure that we have enough trained first aiders and that fire risk assessments are up to date.
* Organising inclusive company events.
* Ordering and restocking office supplies (stationary, sundries, fruit deliveries, coffee, milk and refreshments)

**Skills you’ll need**

* Some experience / interest in an office management role
* Proactive approach
* Hands on and can do attitude
* Highly organised and motivated to make a difference

  

**Salary**  

Up to $60,000 per year  

  

**Please note:** This role will require 5 days per week on-site at the Brooklyn office

 **Benefits**


We support our staff and their careers in every way we can and we offer the following benefits:

  

* 15 days paid time off
* Creative, modern and open office space
* 401k pension plan, provided by Empower in partnership with Trinet
* Medical Insurance
* Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
* Enhanced Paid Parental Leave
* MPB Learning Lab
* Employee Discounts & Uplifts
* Paid Volunteering Days
* Milestone Gifts
* Dog-Friendly Workspaces
* Voluntary Insurance Options
company_description: MPB is the world’s largest online platform for buying and selling used photography and videography equipment. We have offices in Brighton, Berlin and Brooklyn.

title: Production Coordinator
description:
We are looking for a full-time Production Coordinator to join our team in New York. This role will play an integral part in maintaining office operations, supporting marketing efforts, and will assist the content solutions team with projects and clients. This multi-faceted position presents a unique growth opportunity for someone looking to expand their knowledge in the entertainment industry. Primary responsibilities are dependent on client and colleague needs, which may require the ability to be in office at least 3 times a week. If you are eager to learn about our industry, a self-starter, detail oriented, a team player, and ready to work with awesome people, consider applying!

### **WHAT YOU'LL DO**

* Support content solutions team with production projects and tasks,
* Coordinate with finance by forwarding invoices, updating the invoice tracker, W-9's, organizing invoices and receipts, Netsuite management, and attending a weekly finance meeting
* Update and maintain production artist resourcing calendar, support on scheduling producers and artists across all content production projects
* Schedule and help facilitate staff and weekly production meetings
* Maintain and assist with office/production process documentation
* Provide administrative support to content solutions team where needed
* Create and support sales with show reels and archiving of our work
* Support the marketing team with social media projects and tasks.
* Responsible for social media posting and management across LinkedIn, Instagram, and Facebook.
* Plan and maintain social content calendar in marketing drive.
* Greet and escort clients and visitors in the office
* Support the team with client visits; such as ensuring a presentable office environment, schedule catering or reservations, booking travel, etc.
* Be responsible for general day-to-day general office management tasks
* Coordinate office related services as needed; includes cleaning crew, maintenance, catering/snack orders, office supplies
* Handle mail and package shipments and deliveries
* Other office and administrative duties as needed
* This position frequently includes movement such as reaching over head, crouching, and lifting, moving, or carrying items up to 25 lbs.
* Production responsibilities occasionally require this position to be on-set, and may include the use of ladders.

### **WHAT YOU NEED**

* Time management skills; ability to manage and prioritize tasks effectively
* Ability to provide resource management, as well as manage office calendars
* Can work effectively in a team and independently Interest in the entertainment/advertising industry
* Proficient communication skills; both written and verbal
* Familiarity with Microsoft apps – Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.
* Prior experience in video production role is a plus
* Prior experience with social media & marketing workflows is a plus
* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* Ability to be in-office as needed.
* To be considered candidates must be located in one of the following states: CA, CO, CT, IL, MA, MI, NY, TN, TX, VA

#### **WHO YOU ARE**




* Eager to learn and apply new skills
* A collaborative team player
* Detail oriented

#### **WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU**


At Edisen, you’ll get an exciting challenge at an entrepreneurial and global company. With us, you get to work with market-leading brands and exciting customers who will challenge you, and you, them.


Our employee benefits include:

  

* 11 paid holidays per year
* 401k Retirement Plan (employer contributions vested immediately)
* Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* Pet Insurance
* Up to 25 days of vacation
* Up to 14 days of paid sick leave
* Up to 16 weeks paid parental leave


We believe our people and our work make the difference, for our clients and their audience. If you’re looking to make an impact, Edisen is the place for you.  

  

**Compensation:** *$21 - $26 an hour*

#### **WHO WE ARE**


Meet Edisen. We are an independent, global specialist in production and content marketing powered by technology and fueled by creativity. We have global offices but work as one team. We’ve created for some of the world’s biggest and most innovative and recognizable brands, including Ikea, Dyson, Absolut, Netflix, CBS, Polestar, Lego and PBS. Just to name a few.


Edisen comes with a legacy of 25 years of best-in-class entertainment and award-winning post-production services. And we’ve got the Oscars and Cannes Lions to prove it.

 **Join us!**


Edisen provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Facilities Project Manager - Design and Construction
description:
**Reports to: Vice President of Facilities**


**Salary Range: $70,000-$80,000**


**Position Summary:**


The Facilities Project Manager - Design and Construction provides leadership on strategic and operational matters, has excellent planning and assessment skills, successful experience leading change, and can work effectively within a collegial, participatory culture. Directly reporting to the Vice President of Facilities, the individual is responsible for the formal coordination, implementation, execution, reporting, and completion and oversees the operational and budgetary activities of the following Facilities projects: Physical Plant and Grounds, Custodial Operations, Campus Planning and Improvements, and Environmental Health and Safety. The individual will provide highly administrative services to advance the mission of the institution and to foster collaboration across all College divisions and departments. The Facilities Project Manager will provide critical facilities insight, support, and leadership to effectively address the short- and long-term priorities of the institution's facilities.


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* The individual will develop processes and procedures for facilities-related projects and will be the subject matter expert for the institution on monitoring the need to refine and improve project management at the College.
* Monitors and evaluates activities on assigned projects by tracking progress, managing project documentation, preparing status reports and project close out reports.
* Provides technical review and support of multiple capital construction projects. Provides leadership and supervision to facilities staff, including technicians, maintenance workers, and custodial teams.
* Fosters a positive and productive work environment, promoting teamwork and professional development. Manages planning, budgeting, design, consultant and contractor selection, pre-construction bidding, construction management, quality assurance, and project turnover for operations and maintenance.
* Manages a workforce of approximately 30-40 staff and outside contractors for routine services and major repairs.
* Collaborates with the Vice President of Facilities in developing project scope, supports the management of all project development and planning factors, and develops maintenance and operations upon competition.
* Monitors workflow and work products, results, methods, and procedures; serves as the primary contact to the internal and external community on facilities management, capital planning, and construction.
* Drafts “Request for Proposals” (RFPs) in consultation with the procurement office.
* Supervises and coordinates the design and permit process for contractors.
* Fosters collaboration and communication with other campus departments, including academic units, administrative offices, and student organizations.
* Participates in campus committees and meetings to address facilities-related issues and initiatives.
* Provides consistent, timely, and reliable communication between all project stakeholders
* Continuously seeks to stay current in emerging areas in the field by monitoring relevant publications and participating in professional organizations.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's Degree in Architecture, Construction or Facilities Management or other related field
* Valid Driver's License
* OSHA 300 certificate (or willingness to obtain)
* Three (3) years of experience in facilities project management
* Three (3) years of supervisory experience


***Manhattan College is an independent Catholic coeducational institution in the Lasallian tradition. We expect our faculty, administration, and staff to be knowledgeable about our mission and to make a positive contribution to the mission. Applicants from historically under-represented segments of the population are encouraged to apply, as well as those attracted to a college with a Catholic identity. We are committed to a diverse campus community. AA/EO Employer M/F/D/V***

title: Analyst-Marketing
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let’s lead the way together.



How we serve our customers is constantly evolving and is a challenge we gladly accept. Whether you’re finding new ways to prevent identity fraud or enabling customers to start a new business, you can work with one of the most valuable data sets in the world to identify insights and actions that can have a meaningful impact on our customers and our business. And, with opportunities to learn from leaders who have defined the course of our industry, you can grow your career and define your own path. Find your place in risk and analytics on #TeamAmex.


**Where is this role located within American Express?**



The Enterprise Comms & MarTech Experiences (ECMX) team is a global organization that sits within Enterprise Digital & Data Solutions (EDDS). It is American Express’ marketing services centre of excellence with the charter of powering high quality, efficient, user-centric digital marketing experiences that accelerate business growth through optimized enterprise MarTech & MarOps solutions.



This role sits within the DOE & Bonusing MarTech Experiences (DBMX) team within ECMX. The DBMX organization is a global team responsible for enabling Merchant and Card Member growth strategies, while ensuring flawless marketing delivery and a continuous focus on operational transformation. DBMX is responsible for the solution design and delivery of Amex Offers (AO) and all other Digital Offers Ecosystem (DOE) marketing campaigns – All are required to go through an E2E Campaign Execution Process which includes the governance, setup and mandatory review and approvals required before launching in-market.



This is an exciting opportunity to join the Americas DOE MarOps Governance team within DBMX. The team is focused on strategic planning, process innovation, and ensuring flawless execution of marketing campaigns via Amex Offers for the US, Canada and Mexico through data and offer governance, complaints monitoring and issue management.


**How will you make an impact in this role?**


* Providing strategic campaign consultation to partners across Merchant, Consumer, Small Business and other enterprise customers including data and governance guidance to jointly achieve goals and execute flawlessly.
* Working collaboratively with key stakeholders including Marketing Execution, Client Management, Marketing Consultants, Creative Review, Operational Excellence, GCO and Compliance to align on campaign feasibility and overall risk.
* Supporting the identification and delivery of end-to-end process improvements with a focus on governance to increase speed to market and increase capacity.
* Understanding the systems and platforms the ADMG team uses and how they support and impact the review process and campaigns.
* Understanding how Merchant data is set up, which governance principles apply and how to translate that into flawless offer fulfillment, and working with the Setup & Execution team to deliver Amex Offers.
* Partnering with the broader DBMX team to identify operational efficiencies in the E2E marketing process.


**Minimum Qualifications**


* Passion for/interest in Marketing Operations (MarOps) and/or Project Management & Delivery.
* Energetic self-starter with excellent attention to detail, strong process/project management and organizational skills with the ability to think end-to-end.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with ability to translate and explain technical concepts in a simple, easy to understand way.
* Excellent relationship/partner management skills/experience with ability to interact, consult and influence up and down across multiple partners/stakeholders.
* Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to get into the details to identify solutions.
* Ability to operate independently and collaborate effectively with colleagues, in a dynamic, fast paced, global environment.
* Experience working in a deadline driven production-oriented environment.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Prior experience in Amex Offers or similar digital marketing a plus.
* Prior experience in marketing governance and/or offer setup & execution a plus.
* Experience/familiarity with workflow management tools/platforms (e.g., Salesforce) a plus.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office, Slack.
* Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree.


Salary Range: $55,000.00 to $105,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries
* Bonus incentives
* 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
* Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
* Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
* 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
* Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
* Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
* Career development and training opportunities


For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.



We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Creative Director
description:
**The Team**


Our new client is in the media and entertainment space. We will be building a future facing content and production studio, combining hybrid creative talent with innovative production technologies to create industry leading content across digital and traditional channels.


The team will contain over 50 creative and production pros – everything from copy and design, through to video editors and photographers. Most of the team will be based on the East Coast (NYC and Atlanta) with a handful of production roles in our hubs across South America.


Working directly with the client’s marketing, events, programing, and content teams, the team will be responsible for end-to-end content development and production, delivering work for the brand’s paid media plans, owned channels (inclusive of social handles and apps), internal employee channels, partner marketing materials, and events.

 **The Role**


We are looking for a strong Creative Director—art based—to work in our branding and advertising team, reporting into the account Creative Lead. With a clear creative vision and an impressive art-based portfolio, you’ll drive projects across social media, OOH, events, digital, and print creative. At T&P*m*, we value the craft, so expect to be hands-on, shaping concepts and executing ideas that push boundaries. As a senior member on the account you’ll help guide a talented team, ensuring a consistent brand narrative across all touchpoints. We have amazing content and are looking for someone to make noise with it!

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Oversee creative output, directing and approving and adapting a high volume of performance, social, content, CRM, digital and print.
* Maintain a close relationship with the client to ensure you understand business critical needs and maintain an open dialogue on all creative campaigns
* Work closely with the Creative Lead and Operations Director to get to the right briefs that deliver remarkable and innovative ideas
* Work closely with other members of the team to ensure high standard of creative output that delivers against key objectives
* Creative passion to drive strategically sound creative solutions
* Help drive ‘idea led’ digital creative solutions that reflect modern marketing
* Provide leadership in the creative and production process to ensure best in class delivery

 **Skills and Experience Required**

* Must instinctively think digital and have experience of all aspects of the digital comms mix including performance, **social, content, CRM and digital**
* Experience of running a modern creative department of ‘digital first’ thinkers is essential
* Must be forward thinking and embrace creative innovation in the digital space
* Must be an effective manager of people to ensure creative department is motivated and enthusiastic, able to empower teams to take on responsibility and be inspired about their work.
* Ability and proven track record of leading and building high performing digital creative teams
* Must be persuasive and very articulate when it comes to directing or presenting, inspiring confidence and trust in colleagues and clients alike
* Great communication skills, both verbal and written
* Proven confidence negotiating with and influencing peers and senior clients
* Hold the position of trusted partner and advocate to clients, providing advice and guidance
* Big picture thinking with strong attention to detail
* Experience in the drinks or F&B space a bonus but not essential

 **Personal attributes**

* Collaborative team player
* Relentlessly curious about people, technology, brands, design and business
* Self-starting and proactive
* Able to balance a strong point of view with an ability to listen, learn and adapt
* Energised by doing the right thing for our clients; solution and results focused
* Positive, enthusiastic, unflappable
* Strong motivation and drive to succeed

*The pay range for this role is* *$**145,000-$165,000 . Individual compensation will be commensurate with the candidate's experience and local cost of labor. Salary is subject to change based on factors such as geographic location and cost of living in location of hire.*

 *Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United State*

title: Manager - Internal Communications
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



As a Manager of Internal Communications, you will be joining the B2B communications team supporting the Global Commercial Services (GCS) and Global Merchant Network Services (GMNS) businesses. You will apply your proven strategic communications expertise to plan, develop, deliver, and evaluate communications programs that support and sustain a high performing culture within our teams that serve our business and merchant customers. This position will work directly for the Vice President of Internal and Executive Communications and will work closely across Corporate Affairs & Communications (CA&C) and business unit Leadership.



In this role, you will be responsible for reinforcing the overall B2B strategy through thoughtful storytelling and colleague-facing communications. Additionally, you will provide communications support, as needed, to GCS and GMNS Executives.


**How will you make an impact in this role?**

* Support the Vice President of Internal and Executive Communications in delivering consistent, effective, creative, and impactful colleague engagement and internal communications content/programs across our business and merchant organizations.
* Create and execute full communications plans to engage and inform colleagues across digital and live channels, including Slack and the company intranet
* Support Inclusion & Diversity initiatives and additional colleague-led engagement initiatives.
* Manage and coordinate logistics and provide support for various town halls and other large-scale events.
* Craft written and video communications as needed.
* Collaborate, partner and consult with global senior leaders, business partners and colleagues such as CA&C, Executive Offices, Colleague Experience Group (Human Resources), Product Management, Marketing, Field Enablement and other subject matter experts to assess global internal communications needs and create content/programs that ultimately drive business results.
* Ensure high-quality and effective execution and delivery of content/programs – measure effectiveness and iterate as needed.
* Collaborate closely with external/PR teams to deliver to a cohesive, holistic and well-rounded approach to B2B storytelling.
* Provide strategic counsel on sensitive issues with thoughtful messaging support and executive guidance as needed.
* Deliver communications support around operational and sales-driven frontline communications.
* Elevate key wins across the business and merchant organizations at the enterprise level and maximizing impact on the company intranet.

**Minimum Qualifications**


* Degree in Marketing or Communications or related field
* Minimum 5 years of experience in communications – with experience in both internal and external, a plus
* Proven content creation (writing / editing) and communication skills – with track record of followership
* Demonstrated ability to think creatively about work and transform communications into engaging experiences using social tools, video and other media
* Strong PowerPoint and graphic design skills with experience creating engaging presentations and infographics
* Knowledge in colleague and executive communications management, change management
* Strong relationship building skills and the ability to collaborate and work effectively with internal colleagues and external partners
* Track record of managing multiple projects at once in a high-pressure environment
* Fluent user of social media and experience working with enterprise social networking tools
* Enthusiastic, fun, flexible and demonstrates a willingness to learn

Salary Range: $80,000.00 to $155,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries

title: Educator (Cosmetology Instructor) - Full Time - Peekskill, New York
description:
EMPIRE BEAUTY SCHOOL
  

*"To create opportunities for people to improve their lives."*

**Educator (Cosmetology Instructor) - Full Time - Peekskill, New York**

**About Us:**
Since 1934, Empire Beauty School has been educating future beauty professionals in the art of cosmetology. From its Home Office in Pottsville, Pennsylvania, Empire Beauty School continues providing high-quality education and training to future beauty professionals for rewarding careers in the beauty industry. The goal of every Empire Beauty School employee is to support students through every phase of their education, graduation, and career placement. Providing opportunities for others and maintaining excellence in education is the cornerstone of the company and has been from the beginning.

 **About the Position:**
We are seeking dedicated and passionate Educators to join our Empire Beauty School team in Peekskill!


As a Cosmetology Educator, you will instruct, lead, mentor, and motivate our students to achieve success while using our exclusive curriculum. You may also oversee the front desk, greet salon guests, manage the reception area, answer phone calls, schedule appointments, data entry, and manage the Point of Sale system. Other tasks may include assisting with orientations, open houses, and other admissions-related activities.
This is a full-time position that may require early mornings, evenings, and Saturday hours. The pay rate for this position is $20.00 - 22.00 per hour based on schedule and experience.

 **Requirements:*** Active Cosmetology or Cosmetology Educator license per state requirement
* Experience as a stylist in a licensed salon required.
* Experience teaching or training experience preferred.
 **Benefits include:*** 401K, medical, dental, vision, and more
* Generous paid time off
* Paid Holidays

 **Date Posted:** 7/29/2024

title: Director of US Marketing
description:
Hey! We’re Huel and we’re pleased to meet you! We're going to start by talking about our exciting new **Director of US Marketing** position, but if you'd like the quick low down on us first including our growth story then just head to the bottom of this page!

### **The role**


Here at Huel, we are proud of our brand and the reputation we've built in a short amount of time. Now, we want to scale this even further .


We are now looking for a **Director of US Marketing** who is ultimately a strategic thinker, strong leader and expert in US Marketing. No day is the same, but below are areas you will be focusing on day to day...

  

* Trade & Shopper Marketing
* Brand Strategy, Management & Project launches
* Copy and Creative
* Team Leadership & Development


Not yet convinced it's the role for you? Well, then you can click **HERE** to read a more detailed job description and learn about the team!

### **What we're looking for in you**


We are looking for someone with **7+ years of progressive marketing experience** alongside effective leadership skills. You will be managing your own team, as well as working cross functionally with our UK based marketeers so communication skills are key! You will be focusing on executing successful marketing campaigns across multiple channels, so you will have a deep understanding of consumer behavior to ultimately be able to translate insights into actionable marketing strategies!

### **What do we offer in return?**


We have a high-performance culture which is balanced evenly with world-class well-being initiatives and benefits that are tastier than our Salted Caramel Black Edition (and trust us, that’s saying something!)


A competitive salary range of **$190,000-$200,000** per annum depending on your skills and experience  

Flexible working+ Flexible Fridays - 2 days at home and we try to finish our work by 1pm on a Friday!


30 Paid Vacation Days PLUS Federal Holidays  

Free Huel to keep you going


️ 2 weeks a year to work remotely from anywhere! One week in the Summer and one week at Christmas


401K Plan  

Commuter Benefits  

Paid Volunteering Days


Enhanced Family Leave


Dog friendly. The fluffier the better!  

️ Monthly gym membership contribution plus we will also give you your own nutrition plan!  

Free 1-on-1 therapy provided by **BetterHelp**  

Private Medical and Health insurance for you, including free life insurance  

Huel Academy  

Quarterly events to celebrate success - Have you heard about Huelchella?

### **So what next?**


If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, then we’d love to hear from you! Click on apply to this job to send us your CV and cover letter and Ellie from our talent team will be in touch with you.

### **We are Hueligans**


We're all made up of our Huel DNA, but what makes us unique is our individual differences. We've created a culture of belonging and we celebrate the diversity our Hueligans add to our teams. We encourage authenticity, different views, and new ideas to enable us to create products that our customers around the world enjoy and love. Read more about our culture here.

title: Practice Associate II #Full Time
description:
**Opportunity to grow as part of the Practice Associate Career Ladder!**


**Job Summary:**


The Practice Associate II is responsible for the patient welcome experience functions, general administrative work, and scheduling and coordinating of surgical and in-office procedures and other specialty services in support of the day-to-day operations of practice and research patient care in the Department of OBGYN. The Practice Associate II is part of a team that delivers an exceptional patient experience that contributes to positive health outcomes for patients and a work culture of Service-Oriented, Trust, Empathy, Safety, Inclusion, and Communication


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Greet patients and visitors, answer telephone calls and coordinate & schedule appointments, procedures, and other specialty services/tests.
* Conduct pre-registration, check-in, check-out, appointments, and other related tasks.
* Obtain all required registration and intake information from patients; verify and/or update any new insurance or other information in Epic; obtain prior authorizations and referrals for visits and tests and verify eligibility for services; accurately indicate arrivals, no-shows, reschedules, and physician cancellations in Epic; collect all time-of-service and past due payments.
* Manage and review physician’s schedule to ensure all authorizations and pre-certifications for office visits and procedures are obtained.
* Review patient’s registration and insurance for accuracy. Contact patients as needed to update missing information and prescreen patients.
* Assist with coordination of care to other specialties and appointments.
* Verify patient insurance eligibility and benefits as needed.
* Conduct all pre-determination, authorization, and pre-certification. Manage these processes and documentation closely to ensure no scheduling delays.
* Maintain follow up on projects/reports and inform physicians and managers of critical situations or changes.
* Perform administrative duties as it pertains to practice or specialty.
* Manage all assigned Epic work queues. Assist others with backlog or increased volume activity.
* Follow end-of-day closing procedures.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Job Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalency is required.
* A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a medical office environment with knowledge of medical terminology and surgical scheduling is required.
* Candidate must demonstrate strong customer service orientation and the ability to deliver consistent exceptional service while demonstrating tact, respect and sensitivity.
* Candidate must be organized and be able to manage a demanding workload and moderately complex cases in an accurate and timely manner.
* Candidate must demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Working proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word and Excel) or similar software is required, and an ability and willingness to learn new systems and programs.
* Prior experience in Epic/EHR is preferred.
* Prior experience in an OBGYN office setting is preferred.


**Hourly Rate Ranges: $24.04 - $28.77**


Note: Our salary offers will fall within these ranges based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to experience, skill set, training and education.


**61st Street Service Corporation**


At 61st Street Service Corporation we are committed to providing our client with excellent customer service while maintaining a productive environment for all employees. The Service Corporation offers a competitive comprehensive Benefit package to eligible employees; including Healthcare and various other benefits including Paid Time off to promote a healthy lifestyle.


We are an equal employment opportunity employer and we adhere to all requirements of all applicable federal, state, and local civil rights laws.

title: Oyster Shucker
description:
Are you a skillful, professional, and dedicated oyster shucker looking for a positive, welcoming, and fast-paced work environment? Do you want highly competitive pay and benefits, a steady schedule, and teammates and chefs who have your back? Are you looking for a workplace where you can grow and thrive? Then a OYSTER SHUCKER role at Lobster Place Seafood Hall is a great opportunity for you.

**About Us:**

* We are a unique, beloved operation that includes the Michelin-acclaimed Cull & Pistol Oyster Bar and the one-of-a-kind Lobster Place Seafood Hall, all under one roof.
* Our seafood-focused menu, high-quality food, and human-centered hospitality helps make us the most visited food destination in Chelsea Market.
* We’ve been taking care of our guests and each other since 1974 – and we’re proud of a culture that emphasizes both excellence and compassion.

**About You:**

* You take pride in making great food.
* You enjoy interacting with guests and making them feel welcome.
* You value a workplace where you look out for your co-workers, and they look out for you.
* You want to learn and grow while balancing your personal life with a good-paying job.

**Duties and responsibilities** (including but not limited to)

* Prepares mise-en-place for the raw bar workstation.
* Maintains accurate prep lists.
* Maintains ice, oyster and supply inventory in section.
* Inspects ingredients for quality-control.
* Sets up and maintains raw bar display.
* Presents and plates excellent food for service.
* Interacts with guests in a professional and welcoming manner.
* Coordinates pick-ups pick ups with servers and cooks.
* Communicates with the lobster team during and after service.
* Cleans and sanitizes work area and maintains designated cooler space

**Qualifications**

* Understanding and experience of restaurant hospitality.
* 1+ yr experience opening oysters and shellfish.
* Willingness to learn and retain knowledge.
* Good time management and communication skills
* Ability to work in fast-paced environment with frequent deadlines.
* Understanding of NYC health department codes

**Pay & Benefits:**

* Hourly Rate: $18/hr **Plus as much as $10/hr in tips!**
* Paid breaks
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision insurance benefits.
* Company paid life insurance.
* 401K plan w/ company match.
* In addition to Paid Sick Leave, Lobster Place provides generous paid time off depending on position and tenure.
* Employee Discounts
* Commuter Benefits.
* Referral Program- $600 Bonus if you refer a successful hire.
* Employee Assistance Program to help promote well-being and enhance quality of life for you and your family.
* Opportunities for advancement.

**Working conditions**


This job operates in a professional restaurant environment. This role routinely uses standard kitchen equipment including knives and appliances. Kitchen is small and efficient, and temperatures may be high. The workspace is on two levels and ability to use stairs is required.

**Essential Functions of the Job**


While performing the duties of this job, it is required to stand for several hours at a time; walk; sit. The employee must occasionally lift or move kitchen products and supplies, up to 40 pounds. Days and hours of work vary and are generally assigned as a 40 hour per week schedule. This position regularly requires evening and weekend work. This is a full-time (occasionally part-time), FLSA non-exempt hourly position in the Kitchen at Chelsea Market at 75 9th Avenue.


LP Hospitality Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect and building a workplace that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. All employment is determined based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.

  


INDBOH

75 9th Avenue
Chelsea Market
New York NY 10011

title: Campus Undergraduate- 2025 Global Commercial Services Marketing Summer Internship New York, NY
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



**B****usiness Unit/Role Specific Info**



Global Commercial Services (GCS) is a leader in the commercial payments solutions space. This exciting and fast-growing business seeks to drive the success of businesses around the world, rooted in the truth that when our business customers thrive, so do we. We strive to serve all of our commercial clients, from the mom-and-pop store on Main Street to the largest global business.



As marketers at one of the most iconic brands in the world, we play a major role in building authentic relationships with customers. Here, creativity and inspired storytelling combine with powerful data-based marketing and hyper-personalized digital communication to create a genuine human connection that drives business results. As a part of our varied community of marketers, you can have a breadth of different marketing experiences and do virtually anything from connecting small businesses to new customers to uncovering insights that inspire the future of payments. Create a dynamic career while doing work that matters for people and businesses everywhere.



**How will you make an impact in this role?**


* Design end-to-end marketing strategies to drive customer engagement and prospect growth.
* Develop compelling content, offer and creative strategies tailored to commercial audiences.
* Derive insights from the competitive landscape and customer feedback.
* Synthesize analytics and financials to develop data-driven recommendations.
* Document and maintain marketing processes and product backlogs, including feature prioritization.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Product, Analytics, Technology, Legal, Compliance and other stakeholders.

**Minimum Qualifications**


* Currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelor’s degree program
* Students must have a graduation date between December 2025 and June 2026

**Preferred Qualifications**


* Demonstrated interest in commercial payments and marketing.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to distill complex concepts or problems.
* Intellectual curiosity and desire to continually learn about the changing payments landscape and emerging technologies.
* Ability to collaborate with and build strong relationships with leaders, colleagues in different time zones, and cross-functional partners to deliver value.
* Strong project management skills, communication skills, and attention to detail.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present ideas clearly and concisely.
* Demonstrated resilience, proactive problem solving, ‘can do’ attitude, and optimism in changing circumstances.
* Comfortable challenging the status quo and driving continuous process improvement.
* Proficient in analytical and presentation tools, including MS Excel and PowerPoint.

Our team will review completed applications on a rolling basis. We appreciate your patience while we consider your application and will be in contact with you



Salary Range: $24.05 to $63.00 hourly + sign-on bonus



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the United States is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries
* Flexible work arrangements and schedules with hybrid and virtual options with Amex Flex
* Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
* Free and confidential counselling support through our Healthy Minds program
* Career development and training opportunities



For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.



American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.



We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Manager, ESG Program Management
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



Our industry is rapidly evolving, and we need courageous, quick thinkers who can shape the strategic decisions that lead our business forward. Whether it’s negotiating with some of our largest global partners or creating next year’s financial plan, you can influence both our day-to-day P&L and the future direction of the company. As part of the team, you can have the opportunity to learn and use the latest data tools and technologies and explore a range of roles to grow your career. Find your place in finance on #TeamAmex.


**How will you make an impact in this role?**



Global Supply Management (GSM) is responsible for helping Amex maximize the purchasing power of over $11B of third party spend. We provide strategic consultation to the business and provide end to end procurement services. We maximize the purchasing power of the Company to drive the best value from our supplier base which then frees up investment capacity for the Blue Box. GSM together with our business partners manages the supplier strategy for the Company, identifying and on-boarding new suppliers, realizing significant cost saves and revenue generation relating to working with Global Commercial Services and Global Merchant Services to increase billings and merchant coverage and ensuring an optimal user experience for Amex employees and suppliers.


**Position** **Summary:**



Strategic Sourcing and Business Enablement (SS&BE) is responsible for helping Amex maximize its purchasing power and meet enterprise sustainability priorities. This is a global role playing a pivotal role in partnering across categories to develop and grow relationships with business partners to understand objectives, key priorities, and identify opportunities to drive AXP climate ambition and grow diverse supplier engagements.


**Your mission:**



Join the newly established team within our procurement function that is leading the supplier engagement efforts across our ambition to deliver enhanced relationships with diverse suppliers and decarbonize our supply chain. This will be achieved through measurement, strategy development, and partnership with multiple business stakeholders and ESG advocacy groups. This global role will both lead and support core workstreams across all aspects of driving AXP’s diverse supplier and climate ambition.


**Responsibilities will at a high level, include****:**


**Program Management:**


* Develop and grow strong relationships with business partners to gain business unit knowledge, understand goals, and identify issues and potential opportunities (e.g., influence requirements, advise business how to capture the most value from supplier relations); with a customer first mindset and strategy
* Develop robust communication plans for three distinct audiences (GSM, business unit colleagues, and suppliers) to increase awareness of, support for, and engagement with the Amex ESG Ambitions
* Stand up a robust data collection & reporting mechanisms (leveraging CDP) to monitor & track supplier emissions, climate maturities and that will provide regular updates to stakeholders across the business and senior management
* Develop strategic, forward thinking multi-year roadmap to maintain and grow spend with existing diverse suppliers and expand overall number of diverse suppliers within the Amex approved supplier list
* Guide the selection & mgmt. of systems and back-end data infrastructure for our emissions pipeline. Perform data mining, exploration, and analysis
* Prepare regular reports, dashboards and filters tailored to the different stakeholders on supplier climate data/commitments, program overall progress, and key performance indicators (KPIs)
* Maintain and refresh the tool as needed, pulling input from multiple sources incl. internal procurement tools, inputs from suppliers through procurement/business unit teams, SBTi website, annual CDP disclosures etc.
* Collaborate closely across the procurement team to engage suppliers in emission reduction initiatives, including setting and monitoring reduction targets
* Partner with Enterprise ESG team to identify synergies with the GHG accounting tool and how supplier data can help refine American Express Scope 3 emission calculations
* Identify opportunities for continuous improvement in the implementation roadmap and develop the next wave of priority suppliers to engage (incl. strategies, tactics)
* Actively engage BUs on supplier engagement strategy and serve as a sustainability advocate promoting the inclusion of climate in business decisions and interactions with suppliers
* Stay informed about evolving environmental regulations & industry best practices

**Additional:**


* Build strong partnership with select strategic suppliers and manage them effectively
* Partner closely and represent GSM with the Enterprise Sustainability Team and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Center of Excellence, and the associated sponsors to represent and establish relationships across the enterprise and externally where requested
* Maintain and promote the Blue Box Values by ensuring that work is delivered to the highest professional, legal, and regulatory standards, and that the activities subject to review/procurement comply with Enterprise business ethics
* Ability to travel 10%


**Minimum Requirements:**


* **Sustainable Procurement** – strong general manager, including strategic thinking, financial acumen, and negotiation skills with a deep understanding of market opportunities and broader business issues to be able to capitalize on market changes and future trends. Strong project management skills with a history of successfully implementing sustainability or ESG programs across the supply chain
+ In-depth knowledge of sustainability standards, environmental regulations, and industry trends, especially related to Net Zero commitments.
+ Certification in sustainability (e.g., Certified Sustainability Professional) is a plus
+ Strong proficiency in data management, analysis, and reporting, including expertise in sustainability reporting frameworks (e.g., GHG Protocol, CDP)
+ At least 2 years of sustainable procurement experience.

* **Analytical** – results-driven mindset with the ability to synthesize data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations while balancing multiple priorities. In-depth knowledge of sustainability standards, regulations, industry trends, and reporting frameworks (e.g. CDP)
* **Comfort with white space** – ability to navigate white space and bring structure
* **Adaptable** – ability to manage day-to-day business priorities along with long-term strategic deliverables with a positive attitude and the flexibility to deal with ambiguity and rapid change
* **Strategic thinker** – strategic and creative thinker who likes to solve business and operational problems and identify clear action plans and drive resolution
* **Customer focus** – customer-first mindset with knowledge of procurement/sourcing process
* **Strong collaborator** – collaborative partner with strong cross-functional leadership and influence management skills with global experience
* **Excellent communicator** –excellent oral and written communication skills with comfort presenting ideas to leaders at all levels


Salary Range: $80,000.00 to $155,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries
* Bonus incentives
* 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
* Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
* Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need

* Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
* Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
* Career development and training opportunities

Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Daycare Worker
description:
* Caring for children ages 0-13yrs.
* Using creative, hands-on methods of learning, such as artistic expression, free play, and storytelling to help promote healthy learning patterns.
* Encouraging and monitoring social interactions between children.
* Supervising children outside of class time, such as during lunch, out on the playground, or on field trips.
* Making sure that the classroom is clean, safe, and well-organized.
* Setting up the materials and work spaces required for class activities.
* Communicating with parents to learn more about each child's life outside the classroom and having an open field of communication.
* Creating reports to inform parents about their children's progress at the center.'

title: MEDICAL ASSISTANT
description:
**Job Description**

MEDICAL ASSISTANT FULL TIME

\\*MULTIPLE POSITIONS AVAILABLE

Experienced, motivated medical assistants wanted!

If you are looking for a long term position where you can excel at what you do, then this is the position for you!

We are one of the largest multi-specialty practices in New Jersey.

Due to our ever growing patient base, we are expanding our team.

We are looking for strong minded professional assistants who are open to learning and growing with us. Our medical assistants are some of the best! If you are caring, enthusiastic, and responsible, then you could be the perfect fit for our team.

The Medical Assistant role is key in our practice as they are responsible for aiding physicians with daily patient care. They create a strong first impression with our patients and ensure they feel confident in the care they are receiving.

Medical Assistant Duties Include, but are not limited to:

* Greeting patients
* Setting patient up in exam room
* Assisting the provider in the exam room
* Documenting clinical notes
* Refilling prescriptions as directed by the provider
* Returning patient phone calls
* Acting as a liaison between patients and physicians
* Handle all patient matters as directed by physician
* Performing other duties and responsibilities as assigned

***REQUIREMENTS:***

Must have some pain management or orthopedic medical assisting experience  
Must have EMR experience  
Must be able to work flexible hours (Monday - Friday) and travel to other locations  
Must have a reliable vehicle

Must be professional!

\\*Bi-lingual English/Spanish is preferred

*Only serious candidates need apply!*

*\\*\\* STARTING SALARY BASED ON EXPERIENCE!!*

title: Registered Nurse, Per Diem
description:
**BrightStar Care Brunswick & Princeton** is seeking **Per-Diem Registered Nurses** to join our caregiving team to assist patients in their homes. We are looking for a Nurse who can perform skilled services including **Infusion, wound care/vac, and post-surgical care such as managing drains and tubes.** Depending on your availability, and experience, you will also have a chance to work on patient assessments/case management.

Looking for Per Diem/Part-time RN for cases throughout the Southern Middlesex, Somerset, and Mercer county area. You will be resposible for providing nursing services and providing trust and confidence in care within your geogrohical area of preference,

**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\* We are offering joining bonus\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***

Requirements:

* Current unrestricted RN license in the state of New Jersey
* Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in Nursing.
* Wound care, infusion, post-surgical care experience is preferred
* Certified CPR and negative TB skin test or chest x-ray
* Minimum one (1) year of documented experience required
* Possess Nursing assessment skills
* Analytic/Critical thinker.
* Licensed driver with valid automobile insurance
* Reliable transportation

**Responsibilities**

* Monitor patient’s condition and assess their needs to provide the best possible care and advice
* Perform procedures per physicians's order (infusion, drains, blood pressure measurements, administering injections etc.) and fill in patients’ charts
* Adjust and administer patient’s medication and provide treatments according to physician’s orders
* Maintain reports and charts in the system
* Corodinate with office staff to ensure that communications and hand offs are done in a systematic manner.
* Foster a supportive and compassionate environment to care for patients and their families

At BrightStar Care we value each of our employees and care about their well-being. We strive to provide best-in-class benefits packages, including:

* Joining Bonus and Competitive pay
* Weekly pay
* Employee referral bonus program
* On-call bonus
* Free continuing education
* Nurse of the month program
* All Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is provided at no cost
* Weekly, monthly, and annual bonus programs
* Mobile technology to access schedule and case documentation
* Exclusive BrightStar Care Employee Discount Programs

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

**Become part of the team!**
